loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian runs a sari-sari, or convenience store, selling various items to the people in Cortes, Bohol. Vivian is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, candies, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, soda and other beverages. Through this, she will be able to cater to more customers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Vivian dreams of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, candies, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, soda and other beverages

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Perlita has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Perlita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Astria

texts.en:
Astria is 56 years old, married and has four children. 

Astria is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Astria has been fattening pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Astria would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is taking a loan of $1,500 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin).  She is married and has five children and a husband who works as a farmer. She has a lumberyard to generate income for her family and she sells wood beams. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She feels better after she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as wood cutting machines and others. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy wood cutting machines

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Doña blanca de 50 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo de 23 años en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años cultiva maiz, maicillo y jocote con las ventas que realiza de sus granos basicos y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un credito que le permita comprar abonos, pesticidas, herbisidas y foliares para tener mejores cosechas y poder seguir con sus cosechas para poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida con su esposo.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 50, lives in her own house with her husband and her 23 year old son.  She has been growing corn, sorghum, and ‘jocote’ [a tropical fruit] for several years.  With what she gets from her sales of basic crops, and with the help of her husband, they are able to cover the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy manure, pesticides, herbicides, and leaf fertilizers in order to have better crops and to be able to continue with her harvests.  She wants to do this in order to be able to get better income and to have a better life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio grows rice crops in the village of Villa Marzo. He has been in this business for 30 years. Aside from farming, he also engages himself in buying and selling of cows and carabao (domestic water buffaloes). Julio is happily married with three children. Only his youngest child goes to school.

Julio would like to maintain the productivity of his rice field in order to obtain continually better yields and profits.To make this goal possible, he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000, which will allow him to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer and insecticides, to ensure his rice crop has good nutrition. He knows that this loan amount will enable him to earn better income and improve his living conditions. Julio is hoping for continuous access of financial services so that he can continue to support his youngest child's education and sustain all of his family's basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer and insecticides, for his rice farming business.

loans.name: Cherry Ann

texts.en:
Cherry Ann got married at an early age, and now she has two children. She is married to a farmer, and they both plant and harvest rice to sell. They have been in the business for over five years. Upon harvest (twice a year), they earn about 20,000 PHP and use it wisely for the family's sustenance and revolving capital in the farming business. Cherry Ann also raises hogs as an additional source of income.

Now Cherry Ann is borrowing 32,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. She hopes to keep producing good harvests and will save revenue to nourish her hogs too. 

In the future, Cherry Ann will attain success in life if she keeps on improving the harvest of the farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is 35 years old, married and has only one child. Due to financial difficulty, she engages in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She and her husband aimed to improve their status of living in order to satisfy their necessities and save for the future of their child. She planned to raise more pigs to sell but she didn't have enough capital. In this regard, she is asking for an additional PHP 30,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She believes that her loan will be a great help for her to improve the business and is hoping that it will make it profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Yojaira

texts.es:
Yajaira de 21 años de edad, es de origen campesino, y desde joven ha laborado debido a que las precarias condiciones económicas. El pan de cada día debe ganárselo con el sudor de su frente. Desde hace un año inició con la cría y venta de pollos en su localidad a fin de generar los recursos necesarios para colaborar con los gastos del gozar y terminar sus estudios de secundaria. Con esfuerzo y dedicación esta joven lucha por un mejor futuro para ella y su familia. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de pollos de engorde y cuido, con el fin de sacar una mejor producción y aumentar la rentabilidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Yojaira, age 21, has a farming background.  Even since she was young she has worked because of the precarious financial conditions.  She needs to earn her daily bread by the sweat of her brow.

One year ago she started raising and selling chickens in her area.  She did this in order to generate the resources needed to contribute to the household expenses and to finish her secondary education.  With effort and dedication, this young woman struggles for a better future for herself and her family.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy chickens to fatten and raise.  She will do this in order to get a better production and to increase the profitability of her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten and raise.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional items for resale, such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, spices, etc., for her general store business. Eva has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and food vending businesses.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items for resale, such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is from the village of Centro 2. She generates income through her sari-sari store business. She is 58 years old, married, and has three children. She has been running her sari-sari store business for nine years and earns about a minimum of 300 PHP a day. At this time, Leonida is asking for a loan of PHP 22,000 to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, biscuits and other kitchen ingredients to sell. She believes that through this loan, she will be able to obtain more grocery items. She hopes that she will increase her income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, biscuits and other kitchen ingredients to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, a 50-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, has three children ranging in age from 10 to 18. Engaged in a food-vending business for the last eight years, she makes homemade peanut delicacies, including peanut butter and peanut brittle.

Anita has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy plastic canisters, bottles, and more ingredients such as peanuts and sugar. She dreams of expanding her business to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic canisters, bottles and more ingredients like peanuts, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 47-year-old Ramatu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is widowed with 8 children. Four of her children are attending school. Since the death of her husband, she was finding it difficult to survive, so she started this business to create income to support her family.

Ramatu runs a food stand business; she sells palm oil, rice, onions, and Maggi. She has been running this business since 1985. She works at the business every day, even at night. When her neighbors come to buy she will sell, and she has two additional dependents at home. Her business is the only source of income that she has. Ramatu says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuation and transportation problems.

Ramatu has requested a loan in order to buy more palm oil, rice, onions, and Maggi for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her level of living and buy cement to start a construction program. In the future, she plans to build a big house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, rice, onions, and Maggi for resale.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is 39 years old, married with seven children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. He has been in this business for more than six years and earns 3,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products for resale, such as shampoo, soap, coffee and sugar. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for resale, such as shampoo, soap, coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 33 years old and married with four children who are in school. Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTFto purchase additional items for resale, such as spices, eggs, snack foods, sugar, milk, etc. Evelyn has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Evelyn would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional items for resale, such as spices, eggs, snack foods, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie is from the village of Paddad, Alicia. She is married to Montano. To raise her family, Josie is engaged in a direct selling business. She usually sells lotion, deodorant, cologne and powder around her village. She has been in this business for seven years. She receives a net income of PHP 2,000 monthly. To this end, Josie is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy more lotion, deodorant, cologne and powder for resale. She hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more lotion, deodorant, cologne and powder for resale.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas, from the city of Hato Mayor, is one of the members taking a housing loan. This is her 16th loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had her business for over nine years, having started it with her first loan. Her latest loan was invested in the business, in which she sells underwear.

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business, and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their businesses and attending their group meetings. 

Leonidas wants to continue building her house with this loan by making a change in her kitchen by replacing the ceramic or tiles. Leonidas is requesting this loan to buy cement, ceramics or tiles, decoration items, and other building materials. She wishes to have a safe and nice home, as well as to have an improved business. She thanks God, Esperanza Internacional, and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, thanks to all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy cement, ceramics or tiles, and other building materials.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en: Victoriano is a 44 year old married man and a father of two children from Panglao, Bohol. Victoriano earns a living through his hog raising business and motorcycle transport business. Victoriano is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise and to pay for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle. With this loan, he will be able to improve his businesses and income.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise, and to pay for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic ingredients in making “tupig”, such as glutinous rice, sugar milk and coconut, as well as pay for maintenance of his machines.

loans.name: Marionito

texts.en: Marionito is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting corn for sale in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for over 5 years and earns 40,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2008, and he has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jalelah

texts.en:
Jalelah, who appears in the photo, is a 56-year-old married woman from a refugee camp near Nablus called Al- Fara'ah. Jalelah lives in a small old house with her husband and six children, consisting of four sons and two daughters. The family would like to maintain their home and improve its conditions as well as build a new small room to fit the family and their needs.

Jalelah took a 2000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Jalelah and her family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the costs of maintaining the family home and building an additional room.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is 53 years old, married, and has 6 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting coconuts to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 6 years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for her farm

loans.name: Dario

texts.en: Dario is a fisherman from the town of Dauis, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of ten children. Dario is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and paint for his boat. With this, he will be able to fix his fishing boat and improve his daily catch, thus allowing him to sell more fish in the market. In the future, Dario dreams of expanding his fishing ventures successfully.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and paint for his boat.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the materials that she needs and she was able to generate more income. She also sells pizza for additional income. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks of cloth, needles, and other materials needed in her tailoring business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Juanita dreams of having another stall for her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of life and business where finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of cloth, needles, and other materials needed in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
This is Jolly. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed merchandise products and thus generated more income. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jolly hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her family will have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. These fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia is a 37-year-old woman from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. Emelia earns a living through her sari-sari, or convenience store business. Emelia is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract more customers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a responsible mother who aimed to become successful someday in order to give her family a better living. She is 40 years old and has three school-age children. 

Since farming is the main source of their living, she and her husband planned to improve their farming business in order to generate sufficient income to satisfy their family needs. In this regard, Perlita planned to raise more pigs to sell, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional 18,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She is hoping that her loan will be granted to be used in the improvement of her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise.

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Arquímides

texts.es:
Arquímides de 32 años de edad, se dedica  a prestar el servicio de videojuegos desde su residencia, con el propósito de generar recursos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Asegura que su mayor preocupación es su condición económica y la manutención de su hija de dos años de edad, por cual optó por subemplearse. 
Se siente satisfecho con los logros alcanzados porque está convencido que con el tiempo su negocio comenzará a crecer y por ahora les genera lo suficiente para vivir. Con el fin de mejorar el servicio y aumentar sus ventas, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de un televisor y una consola. Sueña con brindarle una educación de calidad a su hija y una vivienda digna a su familia.
texts.en:
Arquímides is 32 years old. He makes his living providing a video-game service in his residence, with the goal of generating resources to sustain his household. He says that his greatest concern is his financial situation and providing for his two-year-old daughter, which is why he opted to try earning money this way when he was unable to find full-time work. 

He feels satisfied with the progress he has made because he is convinced that, with time, his business will begin to grow and for now, it is generating enough for them to live on. With the objective of improving his service and increasing his sales, he is requesting a loan that he will invest in the purchase of a television and a console. He dreams of giving his daughter a quality education and giving his family a respectable house.

loans.use: to purchase a television and a game console.

loans.name: Lorefel

texts.en: Lorefel is a responsible housewife who supports her husband in generating income to satisfy their needs and give their family a better life. They are currently residing in a rural community and they live through farming. They cultivate their farm land by planting vegetables and root crops for sale. Aside from this, Lorefel engages in raising ducks for sale. She aimed to acquire more ducks to raise but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy feed and additional ducks to raise. She is hoping that someday she will be able to improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy and feed additional ducks to raise

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is a 46 year old dressmaker from Dauis, Bohol. She is married and has five children. Isabel has been in the dressmaking business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a fisherman. Isabel is asking for a loan to buy materials for house renovations like cement, nails and others and materials for dressmaking like cloth, thread, and needles. With this, she will be able to improve her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for house renovations like cement and nails, and other materials for dressmaking like cloth, thread, and needles

loans.name: Khulan

texts.en:
Khulan is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in house on plot of land. For the past two consecutive years, Khulan has been selling building and insulation materials, such as bricks, planks, and fiberglass, to local people. Their own house is not connected to a central heating system, and during winter, the family chills down to their cores even though they have completed insulating and renovating their house.
 
Khulan is requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan to connect her house with a central heating system. As a result of her loan, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place. More importantly, their renovated house will enable them to be able to burn less coal and emit less smoke which will contribute to efforts against air pollution. Khulan is very hardworking individual who cares deeply for her children's education and future.

loans.use: to connect her house with a central heating system

loans.name: Otgongerel

texts.en:
Otgongerel, 40 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a five-walled traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on fenced land. She has been selling shoes at the trade center by renting a stall for ten years. Before running this business, she sold cigarettes to locals. Her husband works at a construction site.

During this period of time, demand for shoes increases drastically and selling them now is thus a great opportunity to make a profit. But due to lack of finances, Otgongerel hasn't gone to China to get goods. So she is requesting a loan of 440,000 MNT to purchase a large quantity of shoes from China. As a result, she will be able to continue to run her shoe sales business without worrying about inventory shortages.

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of shoes from China

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a married parent with two children who works hard to support her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income buying and selling coconut shells. Geraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans through NWTF. She has successfully repaid her previous loans.

Geraldine is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as bread, laundry soap, sugar, soft-drinks, snack foods, and other items. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bread, laundry soap, sugar, soft-drinks, snack foods, and other items

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 45 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past four years, Genara has run a general store in the Philippines  where she sells a variety of items such as sugar, shampoo, noodles, snack foods, biscuits and other groceries.

Genara is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as sugar, shampoo, noodles, snack foods, biscuits and other groceries. She would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, shampoo, noodles, snack foods, biscuits and other groceries

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 73 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For over nine years, Erlinda has been a farmer who plants and harvests coconuts to earn a living. She earns 10,000 PHP every month and joined GDMPC in 2010.

Erlinda is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase chemicals for her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for her farm

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is 24 years old, married and has a child. To make a living, Cheryl and her spouse plant and harvest rice to sell. They have been in the farming business for over five years and earn approximately PHP 20,000. She uses it to sustain the needs of the family, to pay debts to neighbors, and as revolving capital in the business. She hopes to keep improving the harvests in their ricefield for more income. Now, Cheryl is asking for additional capital of PHP 35,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for use in farming. The couple hope to become more prodcutive farmers someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for use in farming

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Flordelina 49 years old and married with seven children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For over eight years, Flordelina has been a farmer who plants and harvests vegetables to sell in her local community. She earns 8,000 PHP each month and joined GDMPC in 2008. 

Flordelina is requesting a 12,5000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a farmer and a responsible mother to her two children. Despite being widowed for six years, Myrna still manages the farming business owned by her late spouse. She hired laborers who helped her  to plant and harvest rice to sell. Upon harvest, Myrna is able to earn PHP20,000 twice a year. 

Myrna hopes to gain more income and improve crop production, but she had insufficient funds.  That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP40,000 to buy insecticides and pesticides used for farming. This will give enough nutrition to her rice crop.

Myrna hopes to achieve a fruitful harvest in order to provide a good education to her children. She hopes to become a successful farmer for the welfare of her children someday.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and pesticides used for farming

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a coconut production farm to earn a living. She has been in this business for over eight years and earns 1,500 PHP a month. She has been with GDMPC since 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 3,500 PHP to purchase materials for the production of copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production). She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for copra production

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is from the village of Amistad, Alicia. She is 47 years old and is married to Alex. To earn a living, Teresita and her husband engage in a transportation business using their transport motorcycle. They have been in this business for many years. At this time, Teresita is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy spare parts, oil and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Teresita hopes that she can get the amount she requested.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, oil and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 44 years old, married and blessed with eight children. They live happily in a rural community, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. They aim to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn degrees and becomes professionals someday. Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, Corazon raises hogs for sale. She planned to raise more pigs to sell but she has inadequate capital. She is asking for a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She believes that her loan will help her improve the business and hopes that she will make it profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 38 years old and operates a sari-sari store business. She is married with two children.

She sells canned goods, snacks, soft drinks, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for six and half years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, noodles, detergent soap, bath soap and shampoo. 

In the future, Margie hopes to improve her business to develop their living standards.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, noodles, detergent soap, bath soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en: Jacinto is a tailor from Bohol, Philippines. He has been in the business for more than 42 years now. This is his source of income. Jacinto is asking for a loan to buy cloth, needles, thread, and other materials. Jacinto hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy cloth, needles, thread, and other materials

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is 42 years old, married, and has three children. Her spouse is a farmer and they both manage a ricefield, planting and harvesting rice to sell as their source of income. Carmelita is very industrious in helping her husband. She is now asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP for further improvement of crop growth. She will buy rice seeds, pesticides and insecticides necessary for their farming business. Additional revenue will be invested in a hog-raising business for additional profits and to sustain her children's educational needs.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, pesticides and insecticides for farming.

loans.name: Fedman

texts.en:
Fedman is a 23 year old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He is a father of a one-year old son. 

He operates a motorcycle transport service, transporting customers from one place to another. He has been operating a motorcycle transport service for almost three years. In order to continue to serve his customers and also to augment his daily income, Fedman requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fuel and maintenance for his motorcycle. In the future, Fedman would like to invest in another business to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fuel and maintenance for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
This is Emelinda who is 46 and a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is single and works as a vender who sells a variety of products such as candy, calamine, pepper, garlic, plastics, and other items. Emelinda works hard to provide for her everyday needs and also helps her siblings as well as her nieces and nephews. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members.  Emelinda earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Emelinda is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy candy, calamine, pepper, garlic, plastic and other products to continue her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  Emelinda meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy candy, calamine, pepper, garlic, plastic and other products

loans.name: Policarpia

texts.en:
Policarpia is a 63-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, with three grown children. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells commodities such as noodles, canned goods, condiments and toiletries. 

Policarpia is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to buy additional merchandise to sell such as soft drinks canned goods, soap, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to save for the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, soap, and beverages

loans.name: Rosendo Antonio

texts.es:
Rosendo, se dedica a la agricultura de granos básicos para obtener los ingresos necesarios para aportar al  hogar. El tiene 44 años de edad, vive en casa propia  con su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos; este oficio lo realiza de lunes a sábado de 6:00 am a 12:00 pm, lo aprendió con sus padres desde muy pequeño.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas, herbicidas. Este le ayudara a invertir y mejorar la productividad, asimismo los ingresos.
Su sueño es mejorar  económicamente para tener una mejor calidad de vida  con sus hijos y poder darles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Rosendo grows basic grain crops to earn money to support his household. He is 44 and lives in his own house with his life partner and their four children. He works Mondays to Saturdays from 6:00 a.m. until 12:00 p.m. He learned his profession as a young boy from his parents.

He needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies: manure, pesticide, and weed killer. This will allow him to invest and to increase productivity and his income. He dreams of improving his financial situation so that he and his children can have a better life and he can give them a good education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies: manure, pesticide, and weed killer.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is applying for a loan of $600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin (TRM). She is 38 years old. She runs a kiosk in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy stock for her store, such as fish canes, oil, sugar, coffee, biscuits and other items. She is making good money from selling, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish canes, oil, sugar, coffee, biscuits and other items

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is 54 years old. For the past six years, she has operated a piggery as her source of income. She earns an average of 10,000 PHP every six months.

Bibiana is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy feed, medicines, and vitamins for her pigs. This amount of capital will help her earn greater net sales that will be used to improve her family's everyday life.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines, and vitamins

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a married woman from the town of Dauis, Bohol. She earns a living through her manicure and pedicure business. Juanita works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of their family.

Juanita is requesting a loan to buy more materials, such as nail polish, nail cutters, acetone, and alcohol, for her business. Her loan will allow her to cater to more customers and provide more manicure and pedicure services. In  the future, Juanita hopes to expand her business and explore other ventures to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more materials, such as nail polish, nail cutters, acetone, and alcohol

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa offers home service manicures and pedicures within her area. She has been doing this kind of work for more than 23 years. Luisa is hardworking and has a strong determination in life. She is married and blessed with three children. Two of her children still go to school while the other is done with her degree course.

Through the income gained from her beauty salon business, Luisa was able to improve her way of life, educate her eldest child and afford her family's basic commodities.

Luisa still aspires for continuous growth of her beauty salon business--that's the reason why she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP, allowing her to buy materials such as nail polish, a nail brush, acetone and nail clippers for her manicure and pedicure business. She just hopes that lenders will grant her requested loan amount so her dreams can be realized.

loans.use: to buy materials such as nail polish, a nail brush, acetone and nail clippers for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Jose Virgilio

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo crédito porque necesita dinero para terminar de comprar un vehículo para trabajar con él, ya que su oficio es dedicarse a hacer viajes y a trabajar en la agricultura.
El préstamo anterior le permitió aumentar los ingresos, el cual han sido de mucha ayudo porque la logrado invertir en la compra de productos básicos para el hogar, asimismo adquirio insumos agricolas para el cultivo y han mejorado las condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan because he needs money to finish buying a vehicle for work.  His trade is transportation and working in agriculture.

The previous loan allowed him to increase his income.  This has been very helpful because he managed to buy basic products for his household.  He also got agricultural supplies for the crops, and his financial conditions have improved.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for work.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 53 años de edad, esta casada y tiene un hijo. Ella vive junto a su hijo y una nieta; su trabajo consiste en comercializar mariscos junto a su nuera que su ayudante. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para terminar de construir su casa, ya que en donde vive actualmente no reúne las condiciones mínimas de seguridad y salubridad. La casa deberá ser terminada antes que empiece el invierno para que pueda quede bien.
texts.en:
Gloria is 53 years old. She is married and has a son. She lives with her son and granddaughter.  She sells seafood with her daughter in law who is her assistant. 

She is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo in order to finish building her house.Where she currently lives does not meet the minimum safety and health requirements. The house must be finished before winter starts so that it can be in good shape.

loans.use: finish building her house.

loans.name: Sedana Yoga Group

texts.en:
The Sedana Yoga Group is made up of 10 women who are neighbors in the same village in Baturiti, in the central area of Bali. The group is seeking a loan of 20M IDR, and each member will receive 2M IDR.  The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement family income, and out of their interest in education on best practices for pig raising. This is their first loan with MUK.

Ni Nengah, age 41, is the head of the Sedana Yoga Group. Her husband earns money as a farmer, but Ni Nengah would like to help support her family with her pig-raising business. She plans to sell the piglets after five months of fattening.  With the increase in family income, she hopes to be able to improve her house.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for fattening

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane has taken loans several times already which she used for her businesses. She has a vegetable stand, a rug making business and a food stall. The loans helped her a lot in buying the ingredients, vegetables and materials needed in her three businesses. At the age of 45, she is already a widow. That's why she is working really hard to provide income for her family.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy the fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business. She will also use the loan to buy different vegetables and dried fish. She will also buy different products and ingredients for her food stall. Her profits from her businesses will definitely help to sustain her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mary Jane dreams for a continuous success in her business and hopes that her family will never ever starve. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different vegetables and dried fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 28-year-old married man with three children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. For the past three years, he has had a motorcycle transport business. Charles started as a hired driver and then bought his own motorcycle with his previous loan. After assessing the lucrative nature of the transportation sector, he intends to buy at least five more motorcycles for his business. His major business challenges are high fuel costs and a poor road network which limits his movements.

Charles is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle and have a hired driver who will have to remit 80% of his daily earnings to him. In the future, his dream is to educate all of his children through college.

loans.use: to buy a  motorcycle

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a 26-year-old, married woman, with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

For ten years now, she has been dealing in agricultural produce, but she also operates a retail shop. With the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes pose a challenge to her business growth while her desire is to own a large, sustainable store that can supply her customers all year round.

Rachael intends to use the loan to buy beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over seven years and earns 20,000 PHP a month. She joined GDMPC in 2007, and now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used for the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used for the business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a degree holder and registered veterinary physician. She is 29 years of age and married with two children. 

Mary Ann's business is a pet clinic and at the same time she offers direct selling business; particularly personal products such as cosmetics, toiletries and shirts. She has been running her pet clinic for two years. She is grateful because through her determination and wise management, in both her businesses, she was able to earn better income.

Mary Ann is seeking for a loan of PHP30,000, to allow her to buy stocks of dog food and sacks of rice to be sold in her pet clinic. She hopes that her business will continue to grow smoothly so she could sustain all their daily necessities, save for her two children's education and improve her financial stability. In this way, she could make her goal realistic. Mary Ann is hoping for approval of her requested loan amount so she will have a stable source of income someday.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dog food and sacks of rice to be sold in her pet clinic business.

loans.name: Pulmón Verde Group

texts.es: Marcela, quien en la foto aparece al costado derecho de pie y sonriendo, con una polera negra manga corta y de pelo tomado, pertenece al Banco Comunal Pulmón Verde, que está ubicado en Concepción, VIII región de Chile. En este Banco los socios tienen distintos negocios tales como, venta de anticuchos, muebles, venta de ropa nueva y usada, venta de ropa interior, y pasteles. Marcela trabaja habiendo pasteles, no tiene un local establecido pero aprendió porque debía salir adelante con su hijo, ya que se quedo sola con él y debía tener ingresos para poder darle un mejor pasar. Ella empezó a hacer pasteles, hace más o menos tres años, y aprendió  leyendo  recetas, artículos y libros de pastelería. Lo más difícil ha sido salir adelante con poco dinero, ya que al no contar con el dinero suficiente para establecerse con sus materiales e insumos pasteleros ha debido dejar de trabajar, lo que significa no tener dinero para comprar insumos ni para comer. Ella está consciente y segura de que con el dinero que recibirá le irá muy bien, ya que podrá comprar chocolate galletas y moldes  y los insumos necesarios para vender pasteles y chocolates a algunos negocios que le han hecho pedidos y además están cerca de su hogar. Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es la ayuda monetaria que otorgan, la confianza que tiene con los socios, la ayuda y el apoyo incondicional, además de incentivarlos para poder salir adelante con sus negocios y con su familia.
texts.en:
Marcela belongs to the Pulmón Verde communal bank located in Concepción, region VIII of Chile. In the photo, she appears standing up on the right side of the photo, smiling, and wearing a short-sleeved black top. At this bank, the members have various businesses such as selling kebabs, furniture, new and used clothing, undergarments, and pastries. 

Marcela works by selling pastries. She doesn't have an established location but she learned in order to move her son forward since it just the two of them and she needs income to give him a better lifestyle. She started by making pastries about three years ago and learned from reading recipes, cook books and cooking articles. The most difficult part is moving forward with little money, since she doesn't have enough money to set up a business with the equipment and bakery supplies that are necessary to work. This means that she doesn't have money to buy supplies or to eat. She is sure that with the money she will receive, she will do well because she will be able to buy chocolate cookies, molds, and the necessary supplies to sell pastries and chocolates to nearby businesses that have made orders. Her favorite parts of working with Fondo Esperanza are the monetary help they provide, the trust they have in the members, the help, and the unconditional support. She also likes that the communal bank encourages them to move forward in their businesses and with their families.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola de 36 años de edad ,esta casada con Daniel desde hace 07 años, tiene 02 hijos menores de 07 y 02 años de edad respectivamente, vive en su casa propia la cual logró construir con el apoyo incondicional  de su pareja.El trabajo que realiza Lola es la venta de materiales de construcción, accesorios, entre  otros, para esto tiene un espacio acondicionado en su propia casa, se dedica  a ésta actividad desde hace 04 años  el cual inició con su esposo. Trabaja todo el día y sus ganancias al final del día son muy alentadoras y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite sustentar los gastos que se genera en su hogar, le ha permitido  pagar los estudios de sus hijos los cuales son su principal inspiración de seguir trabajando para darles una mejor calidad de vida, además le gusta porque no trabaja con productos perecibles lo que le permite almacenarlo sin ningún problema, tiene planes de seguir incrementado su negocio con más artículos y abrir otro local.Este es el crédito número 06 con Kiva, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.2500 soles comprará mercadería para su ferretería principalmente comprará tubos de conexión para agua y desagüe , clavos , fierros , entre otros y además complementará su negocio con la compra de triplay ya que sus clientes le exigen este producto.
texts.en:
Lola, 36, has been married to Daniel for seven years. They have two children, ages 7 and 2. They live in their own house, which she was able to build with the unconditional support of her husband. Lola sells building materials and supplies, among other items, from an air-conditioned space in her home. She started this business four years ago with her husband. She works all day, and her profits are encouraging. She is happy that her business generates money to pay her household expenses and to pay for her children's education. They are her main inspiration to keep working; she wants to provide them with a better life. The other good thing about her business is that her products are not perishable and are easily stored. 

Lola plans to stock more items and to open another location. This is her 6th loan cycle with Kiva. She thanks those who have made loans, as they have let her meet her goals. She promises to make her payments on time. She will use the loan of  S/.2500 soles to buy merchandise for her hardware store: connecting water pipes and drains, nails, and metal bar. She will also buy plywood, a product her customers are asking for.

loans.use: to buy pipes, nails, metal bars, and more.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother and sister). She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, fresh beans and cassava. She works at the market and sells on retail basis six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of food stuffs in Uganda. She is aspiring to own a fully-stocked restaurant and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, fresh beans and cassava.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro tiene 63 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 20 años se dedica al cultivo de maíz, y a la comercialización de ganado. El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pagar el alquiler de un terreno para alimentar al ganado que comprar y engordarlo para su posterior venta. Con la inversión, tendrá un lugar para mantener seguros los animales y bien alimentados para engordarlos más rápido y venderlos a buen precio y obtener mejores ganancias para su familia.
texts.en: Pedro, 63, is married and has three children. For 20 years, he has grown corn and raised livestock. He has applied for a loan with Fundación Campo to rent grazing land for the livestock he raises and sells. With this investment, he will have a space to keep his animals safe and well fed. They will fatten faster and bring a good price at market, and Pedro will earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to rent grazing land for the livestock he raises and sells.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es: Sebastiana, de 23 años de edad es casada y tiene dos hijas de dos y cuatro años de edad, inicio su negocio hace aproximadamente tres años, se dedica a vender  bisutería  para dama tales como relojes, pinturas, collares, pulcesas,etc  y ropa interior, gracias a los créditos que fape y kiva le ha brindado, actualmente inicio un negocio de venta de ropa para toda la familia y sus ingresos han aumentado ella solicita un crédito para invertir la mayor parte en la venta de ropa y lo demás en la venta de bisutería, el sueño mas grande que ella tiene y le pide a Dios que sea a corto plazo es comprar un terreno para tener casa propia ya que donde ella vive la casa es familiar.
texts.en: 23-year-old Sebastiana is married and has two daughters, who are two and four years old. She began her business approximately three years ago, selling costume jewelry for ladies, such as watches, makeup, necklaces, bracelets, and more, in addition to underwear. Thanks to the loans given to her by FAPE and Kiva, she has started a business selling clothes for the whole family and her earnings have increased. She is requesting a loan in order to invest the majority of it in clothing sales and the rest in selling costume jewelry. Her greatest dream, which she asks God to fulfill soon, is to be able to buy a piece of land so she can have her own house as she currently lives in the family home.

loans.use: to sell ladies' clothing and to buy costume jewelry

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es: Don Marvin, un hombre casado su esposa es ama  de casa, quien se encarga de cuidar a sus hijos que cada día van creciendo, dos de ellos estudian en una escuela pública, para don Marvin no es fácil cubrir las necesidades  de sus hijos,  porque solamente él trabaja y sus ingresos como guarda de seguridad son muy bajos. A pesar de sus dificultades está intentando hacerle mejoras a su vivienda, con este crédito mejorara las condiciones de un cuarto para sus hijos.
texts.en: Marvin is married. He wife does the housework and takes care of their children, who are getting bigger each day. Two of their children attend a public school. It isn't easy for Marvin to pay for the things his children need because only he works, and his wage as a security guard is very low. Despite the challenges, he is trying to make improvements to his house. He will use this loan to renovate a room for his children.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, sand, and iron to build a room.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 38 años de edad, esta casada con Esteban quien es taxista, vive con su pareja y sus dos  menores hijos de 13 y 07 años de edad respectivamente,  tiene su casa propia la cual compró con el apoyo de su esposo.El trabajo de Lucia consiste en la venta de refrescos y plátanos en un puesto ubicado en el mercado de su localidad, ya tiene un promedio de 2 años en está actividad tiempo en el cual se ha hecho conocida en la zona, ésta  actividad lo realiza sola como siempre con mucho entusiasmo.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un ingreso económico que le da la tranquilidad de poder brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos, es  rentable, y le gusta socializarse.Este sería su préstamo número 04 con Kiva, está agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para avanzar con su negocio.Con el préstamo de 1800 nuevos soles, comprara productos tales como  plátanos y frutas  para ampliar su negocio, buscando comprar en mayor volumen para si tener menores precios  y más acogida y mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Lucia is 38 years old. She is married to Esteban, who is a taxi driver. She lives with her spouse and two minor children, aged 13 and 7. She owns her own home which she bought with her husband's help. Lucia's job is selling juices and plantains at a stall located in her local market. She has been doing this activity for about 2 years and during that time she has become known in the area. She does this activity alone and she always does it with a lot of enthusiasm. What she likes about her job is it allows her to have some income that gives her the peace of mind of being to offer her children the best. It is profitable and she likes to socialize. This would be loan number 04 with Kiva. She is grateful for the financial support that she is getting to advance in her business. With the loan of 1,800 nuevos soles, she will buy products such as plantains and fruit to expand her business, buying in larger quantities to have lower prices and more demand and better profits.

loans.use: to fruit and plantains wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Edwin Antonio

texts.es:
Edwin,de 31 años que se dedica a la carpintería desde hace algunos años Él dice que este oficio lo aprendió cuando comenzó a trabajar desde muy joven en talleres de carpintería le gustó mucho la idea de crear muebles se dio cuenta que era económicamente rentable y tomo la decisión de montar su taller con las pocas herramientas que pudo comprar con  sus ahorros. Desde que recibió el primer  crédito su  vida cambio en este momento ha aumentado su producción y tiene más clientes por eso tuvo la necesidad de hacer este nuevo crédito él está muy agradecido con MiCrédito y  Kiva por darle una mano para poder ir tecnificando más su taller con nuevas máquinas. Él dice  que su sueño es llegar a ser un gran empresario esa es una meta que se ha propuesto además de  tener un lugar donde exhibir sus muebles que son muy bonitos con un acabado especial  y finos.


Solicitó este crédito para comprar madera, playwood, clavos, lija, pegamento, pintura.
texts.en:
31-year-old Edwin has made a living from making furniture for several years. He says that he learnt this trade when he began working at a young age in carpentry workshops. He really liked the idea of making furniture. He realised that it was profitable and he made the decision of building his own workshop with the few tools that he could buy with his savings. 

Since he received the first loan his life has changed. His production has increased and he has more clients. For this reason he needed to get a new loan. He is very grateful to MiCrédito and Kiva for giving him a hand so he can continue making his workshop more technical by buying new machines. He says that his dream is to become a great businessman; this is a goal that he has set for himself, in addition to having a place where he can display his furniture, which is very beautiful and fine with a special finish.

He is requesting this loan in order to buy wood, plywood, nails, sandpaper, glue, and paint.

loans.use: to buy wood, plywood, nails, sandpaper, glue, and paint

loans.name: Blanca Daysi

texts.es:
Blanca, se dedica a la venta de pupusas. Vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos los cuales están pequeños. El negocio  lo posee desde hace diez años por herencia de su madre, este está bien establecido y cuenta con una excelente clientela.
El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de inventario tales como: maíz, aceite, bebidas, condimentos, entre otros.  Esta compra le ayudara a mejorar su clientela, ofrecer mejor producto   y asimismo incluir almuerzos para algunos clientes. 
Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y hacerla mas grande para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca sells pupusas. She lives with her husband and two children, who are small. She has had her business for ten years and she inherited it from her mother. It is well established and has an excellent clientele.

She will invest the loan in buying inventory such as: corn, oil, beverages, condiments and more. This purchase will help improve her clientele, offering a better product and lunches for some customers. Her dream is to improve her housing and make it bigger to offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, beverages, condiments and more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos que frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É operador de máquinas numa empresa privada e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para fazer acabamentos na sua casa. 
No futuro deseja adquirir mais um terreno para construir outra casa para o futuro de seus filhos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é economizar mais o seu salário para poder pagar o empréstimo solicitado.
texts.en:
Eduardo is married and the father of 3 children who go to School; he lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a machine operator at a private company. With this loan he plans to buy construction material (blocks, cement, sand, stone and others) to finish off his house.

In future he hopes to buy more land to build another house for his children's future. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to save up more of his salary to pay off this loan.

loans.use: buy construction material (blocks, cement, sand, stone and others) to finish off his house.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda and her husband are both farmers who live in a rural community. They were gifted with three children, and they want them to earn a degree so that they can find a good job someday. Due to financial constraints, they aimed to improve their farming business to earn a higher income. Rosalinda plans to engage in hog raising to generate additional income. She is asking for additional capital of P17,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and piglets to raise. 

She is hoping that her loan will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and piglets to raise.

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a  forty-one-year-old married man. He is a pig farmer and has done this for eight years. His purpose is to use the loan to buy more pigs for breeding. His customers are major firms but also middlemen who connect them to selling areas. He faces the challenge of fluctuation of demand. Peter will use the anticipated profits to service the loan. He is persistent and sees his business having grown to a regional supplier of pigs in five years time. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs for breeding

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Ángela  es originaria de Limay municipio de Estelí pero emigro con su familia a la ciudad   para mejorar se situación económica sus padres ya fallecieron y ella quedó con su hermana. Su hermana se casó pero Angelita decidió no casarse ya que se  dedicó a trabajar y conseguir para construir su casa lo cual lo logro  se preparó desde hace dos años puso su negocio de pulpería en su casa la cual ha salido todo un éxito empezó como un proyecto compró u poco de pan y café y la gente buscada otras cosas y ella las iba comprado poco a poco hasta tener una pulpería este ha sido su primer negocio, en el cual  la apoya su hermana a veces atendiendo la venta cuando ella sale hacer las comprar sólo tiene los ingresos de su negocio y dos cuartitos que alquila en su casa el crédito lo solicita para la compra de una vitrina para el negocio las ventas han crecido y debe exhibir los productos y para comprar arroz, azúcar aceite, maíz y otros productos sus metas próximas son comprar vitrinas y un freezer sus planes futuros son tener una miscelánea bien surtida de buenos productos comestibles.
texts.en: Ángela is from Limay, the town of Estelí, but she migrated with her family to the city to improve their financial situation. Her parents already passed away and she stayed with her sister. Her sister married but Angelita decided not to marry since she dedicated herself to working and get money to build her house. She was able to do this. She started preparing two years ago and opened her convenience store in her house. It has been a success. She tarted as a project, buying a little bread and coffee. People sought out other things and she would get them little by little until she had a store. This is her first business. Her sister helps her with it, sometimes tending the store when she goes out to do the buying. She only has the income from the store and from two rooms she rents out in her house. She is asking for the loan to buy a display case for her business. Sales have increased and she has to display the products. She will also buy rice, sugar, oil, corn and other products. Her next goals are to buy display cases and a freezer. Her future plans are to have a well stocked store with good edible products.

loans.use: to buy a display case, rice, sugar, oil, corn, etc.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
El Sr. Felipe, está casado con la Sra. Maria hace 30 años, ambos trabajan en un vivero y viven en casa propia en la ciudad de Luque. Ellos son una pareja muy trabajadora, que le encanta lo que hace.
Con gran variedad de plantas para ofrecer a sus clientes, el y su esposa están saliendo adelante, ellos quieren crecer y es por ello que se esfuerza al máximo.
El préstamo que solicita Felipe lo invertirá para la compra de materiales para su trabajo como ser semilla, abono, media sombra, etc.y de ese modo ofrecer mayor variedad de plantas a sus clientes y seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Felipe has been married to Maria for 30 years. They both work in a nursery and live in their own house in the city of Luque. They are a hardworking couple and love what they do. With a great variety of plants to offer their customers, he and his wife are doing well. They want to grow their business, and they strive to meet this goal.

Felipe will use this loan to buy supplies for his work: seed, fertilizer, shading, etc. This way, he can offer his customers a bigger selection of plants and keep working.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, shading, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 50 years old and a very industrious mother of three children. She has a business where she sells cologne, powder, lotion, perfume and lipstick in their village. She uses the income she generates from her business carefully--for her business and for her children’s education. In order to increase her income, she is borrowing 13,000 PHP to buy additional products such as cologne, powder, lotion, perfume and lipstick. She hopes that she can get the amount that she has requested in order to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products such as cologne, powder, lotion, perfume and lipstick.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 49 years old, married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a general store in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over seven years and earns 30,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo, rice and eggs. 

Esther plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo, rice and eggs.

loans.name: Marquita

texts.es: Marquita, de 23 años de edad,vive en compañía de su esposo y su hijo de 5 meses de nacido en su casa es propia.El trabajo de Marquita, consiste en la venta de comidas y bebidas,trabajo que realiza los fines de semana en un local ubicado en su hogar el cual lo abrió ya hace 05 años , en todo ese tiempo ha logrado hacerse conocida y tener una buena cantidad de clientes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un mejor ingreso económico, sigue esforzándose  gracias a que su puesto ya que es muy concurrido .Por tanto éste sería su primer préstamo con Kiva y comenta su agradecimiento por la oportunidad de contar con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio.Con el préstamo de 800 nuevos soles, comprará materiales para arreglar su negocio como calaminas y listones para arreglar el techado y tambien comprará los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus parrilladas.
texts.en:
Marquita, 23 years old, lives in the company of her husband and her 5-month-old child in her own home.  Marquita’s work consists of the sale of food and drinks, work which she carries out on the weekends in a spot located in her home which she opened 5 years ago.  In all of that time she has managed to become well-known and to have a good amount of customers.  What she likes about her work is that it allows her to have a better economic income.  She continues to strive and  thanks to that her place is already well-frequented.  

So, this will be her first loan with Kiva and she comments on her appreciation for the opportunity to have a financial support in order to make progress with her business.  With the loan of 800 nuevos soles (PEN), she will buy materials to fix up her business like corrugated metal roofing and wooden slats to fix the roof and also she will buy the necessary ingredients for the preparation of her barbecue.

loans.use: to fix the roof of her home and to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Miriam Laura

texts.es: Mirian Laura nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 32 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” pues es  una persona responsable y emprendedora pues su actividad económica es la venta de productos nutricionales pues es distribuidora mayorista. Ella también es profesora y trabaja en uno de los colegios de la ciudad de Challabamba. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos nutricionales o energeticos. Su sueño es comprarse un carro y construir una casa en la ciudad del Cusco. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en: Mirian Laura was born in the Challabamba district and still lives there today. The Challabamba district is located in the province of Paucatambo in the department of Cusco, Peru. Mirian Laura is 32 years old and has a common-law partner with whom she has two children. She belongs to the Virgen de Chanca communal bank. She is a responsible and enterprising woman whose primary job is selling nutritional products wholesale. She is also a teacher and works at one of the schools in Challabamba. At this point, she is requesting a loan to buy more nutritional and energy products. Her dream is to buy a car and build a house in Cusco. She is thankful to everyone for the loan and promises to punctually make all of her payments.

loans.use: to buy more nutritional products

loans.name: Sumber Bunga Group

texts.en:
For housewives in Bali, it has become common to keep pigs at home to help support the family in addition to the husband's income. Apart from farming, they can help meet the needs of daily life by raising livestock, especially pigs. However, there are several obstacles in developing the business, including limited knowledge of business management and limited access to capital. To overcome these problems, the women pictured above decided to unite into one group so it would easier to communicate amongst themselves and obtain funding.

Wayan is head of the Sumber Bunga Group and runs a pig-breeding business. She has 3 children, 2 of whom work in the city. To increase her business, Wayan invited group members to participate in loan programs for small businesses from MUK. She will use her portion of the loan to buy three piglets and to buy feed. In 5 months, the pigs will be ready for sale. The income gained from this effort will be used entirely to support her family.

loans.use: To buy three piglets and to buy feed

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
This is Narcisa. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed products and this gave her a chance to have higher income. She is working hard to continuously provide income for her family's everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy clothing, footwear, cosmetics and other products for her business. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Narcisa hopes for a continuous growth in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for clothing, footwear, cosmetics and other products for her business.

loans.name: Capistrana

texts.en: Capistrana is a 34-year-old married woman from Talibon, in the province of Bohol. She has 3 children, the youngest of whom is 7 and the oldest of whom is 13. She is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for almost 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and more rice seedlings so she can increase her harvest and sales. In the future, Capistrana would like to invest in another business to improve her family's livelihood and support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and more rice seedlings

loans.name: Antonieto

texts.en: Antonieto is a 46-year-old married man and a father of five children. The family lives in Dauis, in the province of Bohol. Antonieto has been engaged in the fishing business for more than 15 years. This has been his source of income. He is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items. With this loan, he will be able to improve his business so it is successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, who is separated, is 41 years old and lives in Carmen Annex, Osamiz City. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the business as a way of generating extra income and earns about 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for 2 years.

Erlinda just recently became a member of GDMPC. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP and intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. In the future, she wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation and buy feed for his poultry project.

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.en:
This is Mercedez. Her previous loan was a big help in her business, enabling her to buy needed spare parts for her tricycle. She also has a van that she rents for additional income. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs, and the earnings facilitated by the loan helped in the education of her children and in the family's household expenditures.

Mercedez would like to apply for another loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to pay for spare parts and for the maintenance of the tricycle unit. The profits from this business will definitely help her to meet the family's daily needs as well as support her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mercedez hopes to have another vehicle in the future and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15-30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 57 years old and is engaged in a poultry business. She has been in this business for 20 years. Myrna is married and blessed with three children. She raises her children through her business. Myrna needs additional funds to buy more chickens and ducks to raise. In this regard, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy chickens, ducks and feed for them. She hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens, ducks and feed for them.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a twenty-five-year-old married woman with one child who lives in Kasese, Uganda. After realizing that her husband could not meet all of the family's needs with his wages as a casual laborer, she decided to set up a retail shop.
