She works every day, and she can work for approximately eight hours. She works cutting and packing, as well as other things. She believes it is going well for her because of her efforts and the friendly way she treats everyone. Rita is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thank to their help, she will be able to cover her educational costs, like tuition and enrolling in a new cycle. This way, Rita will be able to continue with her studies in a suitable manner, and little by little she hopes to achieve her big dream of having her own business.

loans.use: to cover educational expenses.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Monica es una mujer de 26 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Monica se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Bisteck para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Monica trabaja como asistente en una empresa municipal de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Monica se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una laptop, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder realizar sus trabajos y practicas académicas, de esta manera Monica podrá cursar sus estudios adecuadamente, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una gran profesional.
texts.en: Monica, 26, is single and lives in the city of Pucallpa with her parents and siblings. She is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, who has a real drive to move forward. Thanks to the effort and support of her parents, Monica is studying a professional degree in Accounting. In her free time, she likes to read and sometimes she cooks a delicious Bistec (steak) to share with her family. On her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, she works as an assistant in a municipal company in her city. She works every day for approximately eight hours and she believes it is going well for her because of her efforts and the friendly way she treats everyone. Monica is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thank to their help, she will be able to buy a laptop, which will really help her to be able to do her academic work. This way, Monica will be able to study in a suitable way. She will keep studying and making an effort to achieve her dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Mbatovi Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mbatovi está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y tienen la mejor de las predisposiciones para poder trabajar y ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirta, quien comenta que se dedica a la venta de leche. Cuenta que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas para que la leche que vende llegue a la mesa de sus clientes para el desayuno. Es muy sacrificada y emprendedora esta mujer, y quiere crecer en su negocio y seguir dando a su clientela lo que necesita.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche, ya que podrá tener un mayor stock y seguir dando buenos productos a sus clientes.
texts.en: The group named Mbatovi are requesting their first loan from the women's committee, where they all work and are dedicated to doing their best and helping their families. One of the members is Mirta and she sells milk. She explains that she works from very early in the morning so that the milk that she sells arrives to the customers' tables for their breakfasts. She is selfless and hard-working and wishes for her business to grow so that she can continue giving her customers what they need. She is requesting this loan to invest in buying milk so that she can have more stock and carry on giving her customers the highest quality product.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline has been in the charcoal selling  business for three years. She has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 which she intends to use to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. Her business is located in a good area with the potential for more customers.

Pauline will use the anticipated profits to expand her charcoal business. Her future goals are to expand the business and buy a piece of land. Pauline is a focused lady.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a borrower aged 40 years. She is single and has seven children aged between three years and 19 years. Nuru has been running a restaurant for 10 years. The business is located in a busy residential area from where the customers come. She faces the challenge of needing capital to expand her business.

Nuru has borrowed a loan of KES 30,000 which she intends to use to buy more wheat flour, beans and potatoes for her restaurant business. She intends to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand the business. This is Nuru's second loan with SMEP DTM. Nuru's future goals are to expand her business and educate her children. She is wise and trustworthy.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour, beans and potatoes

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
This is Pinky who previously accessed a 22,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more phone accessories, slippers and other personal products. Her earnings have been a big help for  her children's education and for personal, household and business expenditures.

Pinky would like to apply for another 28,000 PHP loan to buy phone accessories, slippers and other personal products to sell in her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Pinky dreams of a continuous growth in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy phone accessories, slippers and other personal products to sell in her business.

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es: david de 39 años de edad se dedica a la reparacion de todo tipo de electrodomesticos desde hace varios años trabaja en su lugar de residencia y tiene mucha clientela pues deja los aparatos muy bien arreglados, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo realizado logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en casa propia, El solicita un credito que le permita comprar materiales que le sirven para su trabajo como: repuestos de muy buena calidad, para que el cliente quede satisfecho y el pueda tener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
David is 39 years old and has been repairing all types of household appliances for many years. He works from home and has many customers because he does very good repair work on the items they leave with him. With the income he generates from his work, David is able to pay for the household expenses. He lives in his own home with his wife and three children.

David is requesting a loan so that he can buy materials that he uses in his work, including spare parts that are of high quality. This will enable him to satisfy his customers and generate more income so that he can provide his family with better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials for his repair work.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Bella is engaged in a hog-raising business to earn additional income. She is 47 years old and has two school-age children. She and her husband are aiming to improve their standard of living in order to satisfy their needs and to support their children's education. 

Bella planned to raise more pigs to sell but she did not have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She believes her loan will be a great help to her in improving the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 49 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Esther owns and operates a motorcycle transport  business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. 

Esther joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and new tires so she can provide a better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated  to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and new tires

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

Flordeliza would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics to sell in her business. This will increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better as having more items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Flordeliza dreams of having her own franchise and hopes to give her children a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics to sell in her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman: she has four children, all of whom attend school. Alice owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Alice operates a firewood-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her area of business.
 
With the KES 20,000 loan, Alice wants to purchase bundles of firewood to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood to sell

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 27 years old. For the last four years, he has earned a living by selling goods at his general store in Malindi. He earns a monthly profit of KES 7,640. 

Jackson was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for his second loan of KES 30,000 to buy more stock of cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks and flour to sell. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay his nephew's school fees and also to expand his business. His goal for the future is to continue growing his general store so that he continues to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks and flour

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is an industrious housewife who operates a fish-selling business as a source of income. Through her hard work and her business, her family’s daily needs are able to be met. But she wishes to earn more income so she can save money for future use. 

Violeta is currently requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more fish to sell. This would increase her daily net sales and help her to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Don oscar de 39 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, el tiene una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia como lo muestra la fotografia con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Oscar necesita hacerle una mejora a su vivienda como el cambio del techo y otras necesidades que tiene la casa ya que con lo que gana en la tienda no le es suficiente para realizarlo, por eso solicita un credito para cambiar el techo y otras cosas a su vivienda para que su familia y el puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en:
Don Oscar is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He has a small store in his home, as shown in the photograph. With the income he earns, Oscar is able to pay for some of the household expenses.

He needs to make improvements to his home, such as replacing the roof and other repairs around the house. The income he generates from his store is not sufficient to complete these projects, so he is requesting a loan to replace the roof and to perform other repairs on his home so that he and his family can live more securely.

loans.use: to buy materials in order to replace the roof of his house and to perform other home repairs.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar, aged 50, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He has been making and selling ornament boxes to local people for 19 consecutive years and he likes his profession. After graduating from university, his son can contribute to the generation of family income by working. 

The family lives in an old house on a plot of land. Their house has been deteriorating over the years and, especially in winter time, family members are chilled to the bone due to the vulnerable walls and door. So Ganbaatar is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials, he can repair and insulate his house thus providing comfortable and warm accommodation for his family. Renovating the house will enable the family to burn less coal thus emitting less smoke and contributing to the efforts against air pollution. Ganbaatar is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 26-year-old married man who describes himself as patient. He operates a charcoal business where he sells charcoal to commercial and local customers. Denis has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a shopping centre and his primary customers are local people at the shopping centre. 

Denis describes his biggest business challenge to be having low borrower purchasing power. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more charcoal to sell in his retail store. His business goal is to achieve stability within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is a widowed woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a pottery-making business. She sells native pots made from clay. Aside from her pottery-making business, she operates a variety store. Dioscora sells items like biscuits, beverages, shampoos and toiletries. 

She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more clay and items like coffee, soaps, noodles and canned goods to sell in her variety store. In the future, Dioscora would like to expand her business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy more clay and items like coffee, soaps, noodles and canned goods to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Dúo Damas Laboriosas Group

texts.es:
DÚO DAMAS LABORIOSAS
LA SEÑORA VILMA DEL CARMEN DE 64 AÑOS DE EDAD ELLA VIVE VIVE EN LA ALDEA DE SANTA ANA ANTIGUA GUATEMALA  Y SIEMPRE SE HA DEDICADO AL NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE  ROPA AMERICANA Y COMO ACTIVIDAD SECUNDARIA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION Y VENTA DE DULCES TIPICOS  COMO:  COCADAS, MANZANILLAS ,CAMOTES ETC. LE GUSTA EL NEGOCIO Y DE ESA  MANERA HA PODIDO CONTRIBUIR CON LA NECESIDAD ECONOMICA DE SU FAMILIA. ELLA ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE ROPA AMERICANA DE SEGUNDA MANO PARA LA VENTA, Y TAMBIEN PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PARA LA ELABORACION DE DULCES TIPICOS.
texts.en:
Industrious Women Group

Sra. Vilma del Carmen is 64 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Santa Ana, Antigua, Guatemala. She has always been in the business of selling American clothes. Vilma also has a side business of making and selling traditional sweets such as coconut cookies, nance fruit desserts, candied sweet potatoes, and other products. She enjoys her business since it allows her to contribute toward the financial needs of her family.

Vilma is requesting a loan so that she can buy secondhand American clothing to sell. She will also buy supplies for making traditional sweets.

loans.use: to buy secondhand American clothing to sell and supplies for making traditional sweets.

loans.name: Ñepytyvo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ñepytyvo está en su ciclo número 9º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una de ella está poniendo su grano de arena para poder mejorar las vidas de todas. Quieren salir adelante y ayudar a los suyos.
Maria, una de las miembros del grupo, cuenta que se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo y le está yendo muy bien ya que sus comidas son muy aceptadas por sus clientes. Ella esta creciendo cada vez mas y eso es gracias a que ella se esfuerza mucho siempre.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, jamón, queso, huevo, condimento, harina y demás insumos para poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes con esas delicias que prepara.
texts.en:
THe "Ñepytyvo" group is on its ninth cycle as part of the women's committee programme where everyone is putting in their own work to improve everybody's lives.  These women want to prosper and to help those around them

One member of the group, María, tells us that she makes a living selling all types of meals.  She says the work is going very well as her food is much liked by her customers.  She is growing all the time and this is due to the fact that she is constantly putting a lot of effort into her work.

María is applying for this loan to invest in buying vegetables, meat, ham, cheese, eggs, condiments, flour and other supplies so that she can continue to delight her customers with her delicious meals.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, ham, cheese, eggs, condiments, flour and other supplies.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Renacer está en su ciclo número 21º del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo muy trabajador y luchador y eso se puede ver dentro de los ciclos que ya pasaron, ellas sueñan con poder seguir luchando para dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan.
 A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando sus vidas.
Mirta, una de las miembros, se dedica a la venta de bebidas, comenta que los fines de semana es cuando más ventas tiene. Ella por medio de este negocio da a su familia todo lo que necesitan y cubre los gastos del día a día. Ella quiere que con el tiempo su negocio vaya creciendo y tenga mejores ingresos.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas como ser vinos, cervezas, gaseosas y demás y de esta forma seguir dando a sus clientes lo que piden.
texts.en:
This group, called "Renacer", is on its 21st loan cycle as part of the women's committee group.  We have seen throughout the previous loan cycles that this is a hard-working and feisty group.  The women dream of being able to continue fighting to give their families everything they need.

Through effort, constant work and the successful women's energetic performances in  business, the women's lives are improving.

Mirta, on of the group's members. makes a living selling drinks.  She tells us that she sells most on the weekends.  Through this business Mirta can give her family everything they need and can cover daily household costs.  Mirta would like her business to grow over time so that she can have a higher income.

Mirta is applying for this loan so as to buy drinks such as wine, beer, fizzy drinks and more.  Through this she will be able to satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy wine, beer, fizzy drinks and more.

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
Derlis, es de la Ciudad de Santaní,  es soltero, vive con sus padres, es comerciante se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios en general anexo maxi y mini carga cuenta con su propio local, lo cual le ayuda mucho.
Es un señor trabajador, honesto y muy responsable, empezó a trabajar como vendedor en una casa comercial donde se vende electrodomésticos y celulares en general, su sueño de siempre era de trabajar en forma independiente así no depender más de otra persona,  a través de su esfuerzo y dedicación y  trabajando honradamente y con mucho sacrificio pudo lograr su objetivo y formar su propio negocio.
Derlis solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de celulares y accesorios para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Derlis is from the city of Santaní. He is single, lives with his parents and sells cell phones, cell phone accessories, attachments, and top-up phone cards. He has his own store which helps him a lot. He is a hard-working, responsible, and honest man. He started to work as a seller in a commercial center where he sold household electrical appliances and cell phones, but his dream was always to work for himself and not have to depend on anyone else. Through his efforts and dedication, and working honestly and making a lot of sacrifices, he has managed to achieve his goal and start his own business. Derlis is requesting this loan to invest in cell phones and accessories so that he can continue making sales and helping his family.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Marlenis Esmeralda

texts.es:
Marlenis tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos. Ella se dedica  a realizar los oficios domésticos en casa y a las labores del campo, trabajando como jornal en los cultivos de caña de azúcar y de maíz. Estas actividades las aprendió por la necesidad de llevar el alimento a sus hijos y también lava ropa de personas que solicitan sus servicios. Para comprar los insumos que necesita para llevar a cabo sus labores, debe viajar en bicicleta durante veinte minutos y luego paga transporte para llevarlos a su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos novillas, para que produzcan leche a futuro para sus hijos. Ella siempre ha querido poseer ganado y esta época es la propicia para engordarlos y que pronto produzcan leche. Otra de sus metas es sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz para vender la producción a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Marlenis is a 32-year-old single mother with four children. She devotes her time to the household chores and to the farm work. Marlenis works as a farm laborer, taking care of sugar cane and corn crops. She learned these skills out of necessity because she needed to feed her children. Marlenis also takes in laundry from people who request her services. To buy the supplies that she needs to carry out her work, she must travel 20 minutes by bicycle in order to bring those items to her house.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy two heifers that will produce milk in the future for her children. Marlenis has always wanted to own cattle, so this season is an appropriate time for fattening them in order that they can produce milk soon. Her other goals include planting 7,000 square meters of corn so that she sell what she produces at a good price.

loans.use: to buy two heifers for future milk production.

loans.name: Pailino

texts.es: El socio nació en la comunidad de Uscarmaca pero vive en el distrito Challabamba. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Él tiene 42 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos.  Él pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” pues es  una persona responsable y emprendedora pues sus actividades económicas es cortar árboles,  la construcción de casas y la Agricultura, él tiene un pequeño terrero agrícola donde siembra papa, olluco, maiz, haba y otras cosas más. Desde muy joven aprendió sobre  la agricultura pues sus padres le enseñaron. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. Su sueño es comprarse un carro y una casa. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas. (La comunidad de Uscamarca está ubicado en el distrito de Santo Tomas de la provincia de Chumbivilcas, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
This borrower was born in the community of Uscarmarca, but he currently lives in the District of Challambamba. The District of Challambamba is located in Paucartambo Province in the Department of Cusco, Peru.

The borrower is 42 years old, married, and has four children. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Chanca”. Known as a responsible and enterprising person, he engages in business activities such as cutting down trees, building houses, and farming. The borrower has a small plot of land on which he grows potatoes, ulluco, corn, beans, and other crops. He learned how to farm at a young age from his parents.

The borrower is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers. His dream is to buy a car and a house. He is grateful to everyone for this loan and promises to be punctual with his payments.

The community of Uscamarca is located in the District of Santo Tomas in the Province of Chumbivilcas, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 27-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is employed, but the small salary he earns is not enough to cover all the family's needs. He is requesting a youth loan from AMB to cover the cost of buying furniture for his bedroom. Taking this loan will enable him  to create suitable home conditions for himself, and enable him to enjoy living in his house.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his bedroom.

loans.name: Antlaq

texts.en: Antlaq is 26 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Haja, Yemen. She is a housewife who works hard to improve her living standards. She has a small house which is vulnerable to falling down at any time. Home repairs require a lot of money. She started renovating her house but now she is short of money. She needs to complete the renovation task, so she asked for a youth loan of 50,000 YER to buy cement to use for her house. She hopes that she and her family can live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy cement for house repairs

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is 46 years old, married and a mother of three children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling fish in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 6,000. 

Furaha was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her second loan of KES 20,000, to buy more stock of fish for her business to sell to her customers. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children and expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue with her business with a view of owning a fish depot in the area.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish to sell

loans.name: Karla Edith

texts.es: karla de 30 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijo, ella tiene un negocio de salon de belleza desde hace 5 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de 8:00 am a 7:00 pm de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. karla solicita un credito para poder comprar productos para su salon de belleza como: cremas, shampoos, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y asi podra obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Karla is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three children. For the past five years, she has managed a beauty salon in her home. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M., Monday through Sunday. Karla has many clients because she does very good work. With the income she generates, she is able to help her husband with paying the household expenses.

Karla is requesting a loan so that she can buy products for her beauty salon such as crèmes, shampoos, hair clips, scissors, and other necessary items. As a result, she will generate more income so that she can help provide better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, shampoos, hair clips, scissors, and other necessary items for her salon.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a widow and blessed with three children. Her eldest has settled for marriage, the middle one is out of school and the youngest is still studying.

Winnie offers direct selling and buys damaged gold and silver jewelry in her local community. She has been engaged in her direct selling business for one year. She is thankful because through her earned income and patience, she has been able to improve her sales. Now, she still aspires for continuous growth of her direct selling business and so, is buying and selling damaged jewelry. In order to fulfill her goal in life, she is seeking a loan of PHP 10,000. This amount will be used to buy stocks of a personal collection such as perfumes, detergent soap and hand & body lotion. She hopes that with this loan, she can further improve her way of living, increase her income and educate her youngest child who is currently in her second year of college.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as perfumes, detergent soap and hand & body lotion to sell

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 60 years old. She lives alone in Vani District. Manana requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and poor living conditions. The only source of the income for Manana is her monthly pension.
 
Manana requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Manana has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Manana will start trading in plastic dishes. She will purchase at the wholesale price and resell with a price markup to the villagers. This will bring Manana a good income. Part of the profit she will reinvest in the same field in order to continue her business. Another part Manana will use for her house renovation so she can have better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase plastic dishes to sell

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is 43 years old, married and a mother of five children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables from her food kiosk in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of about KES 10,000 from the business. 

Bahati was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000 to buy additional stock for her kiosk such as tomatoes, oranges, onions, and pineapples to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as continue expanding the business.

Bahati's goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that she can uplift her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her kiosk such as tomatoes, oranges, onions, and pineapples

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Veronica is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cooking ingredients in Aburaman Nkwanta (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years.  Veronica is married and has three children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

Veronica wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooking ingredients. In the long term, Veronica plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is married and has one kid who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a motorcycle transport business from door to door. In addition, she operates a poultry farming business, which gives her another source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbors. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KSH 50,000, she wants to add to her savings and purchase another motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to add to her savings to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Jesinta

texts.en:
Jesinta is 65 years old, married and a mother of four children. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by selling goods at her general store in Mpeketoni, Lamu. She earns a monthly profit of KES. 9,000. 

Jesinta was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer and is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000, to buy additional stock for her shop such as cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, and cooking flour to sell to her customers. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children and expand her general store. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her shop such as cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, and cooking flour to sell

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready to wear items to sell. 

Ludivina has been in this business for four years. Ludivina earns more income from pig fattening.

Ludivina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ready to wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Anamelva

texts.es:
Anamelva, de 32 años de edad, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus  02 hijos en su casa propia.
El negocio que tiene Anamelva  es la venta de comidas, como almuerzos trabajo que realiza de lunes a viernes atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes logrando tener una buena acogida y demanda, además los domingos venden parrilladas de pollos, realizando este negocio desde hace 08 años.
Le gusta su negocio pues comenta que le gusta cocinar además obtiene un buen ingreso económico el cual le permite pagar sus cuentas y gastos de su hogar aunque no le gusta el cansancio físico que obtiene por levantarse muy temprano , pero eso no la desanima y continúa en su negocio, por eso desea ampliarlo y techar su establecimiento para atender con mayor eficacia.Este será el primer préstamo con Kiva. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles los invertirá en el arreglo de su piso asiéndolo de cemento y su techo para así atender más cómodamente a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Anamelva is 32 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. Her business involves selling food, such as lunches. She works Monday through Friday. By attending to her customers in a friendly manner, she has been able to achieve good reception and demand. In addition, she sells grilled chickens on Sundays. Anamelva has been in business for eight years.

She says that she enjoys her business because she likes to cook. In addition, she is able to generate a good income so that she can pay her bills and household expenses. However, she does like being fatigued as a result of having to wake up very early. Anamelva is not discouraged and continues with her business. She wants to expand and enclose her establishment so that she can serve her customers more efficiently.

This will be her first Kiva loan. She hopes to receive support so that she can follow through with her plans. The amount of 800 PEN that she requested will be invested in repairs to her roof and cement floor so that she can serve her customers more comfortably.

loans.use: to repair the floor and roof of her restaurant.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en un vehículo, lo realiza todos los días y lo lleva a cabo desde hace cinco años. José, está soltero, no tiene hijos y solo vive con su madre, no posee ayuda del extranjero.
El crédito que requiere le permitirá comprar diversidad de verduras y frutas para luego venderlas tales como: tomates, plátanos, papas, cebollas, manzanas, uvas, naranjas entre otros; este le ayudara a incrementar las utilidades y la capacidad económica.
Su objetivo es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
José sells fruits and vegetables out of his vehicle. He works every day and has been in business for five years. José is single and has no children, but he lives with his mother. He does not receive financial assistance from anyone living abroad.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a variety of vegetables and fruits that he can sell such as tomatoes, bananas, potatoes, onions, apples, grapes, oranges, and other items. This will help increase his profits and his financial capacity. His goal is to have a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, bananas, potatoes, onions, apples, grapes, oranges, and other type of produce.

loans.name: Romula

texts.en: Romula is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Cortes, Bohol. Romula runs a food store selling home cooked foods to the people in her locality. Romula is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for food vending like rice, fish, vegetables, meat, cooking oil and seasonings. Through this, she will be able to cook more and sell more food. In the future, Romula hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food vending like rice, fish, vegetables, meat, cooking oil and seasonings

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Rita is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling pepper in Aburaman Nkwanta (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for one year. Rita is married and has two children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Rita will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of pepper, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rita plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper to sell

loans.name: Francia

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Francia quien con su anterior credikiva compró materiales con los cuales elaboró muchas artesanías y surtió su punto comercial. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo financiamiento mediante el cual comprará nuevos productos artesanales con los cuales aumentará sus ventas pues en otras ciudades sus familiares también están vendiendo sus productos y tienen mucha aceptación en estos mercados que ya han hecho sus pedidos. Ella está muy agradecida por el apoyo que han hecho con sus préstamos y espera seguir trabajando con esos recursos.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Francia who used her previous CrediKiva loan to buy materials to make many crafts to stock her sales room.  She is currently requesting a new loan to buy new craft products so she can increase sales.  In other cities her relatives are also selling her products which are very popular in those markets, which have already placed orders.

She is very grateful for the support you have made through your loans and she hopes to continue working with these resources.

loans.use: To buy new craft products.

loans.name: Dona María

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Dona, quien con su credikiva compró mercancia que vendió rapidamente y su clientela estuvo muy feliz con sus camisas nuevas, pantalones y cubrelechos. En la actualidad está aplicando nuevamente a un credikiva, con el cual comprará electrodomésticos menores como abanicos, planchas, ropa como sueteres, jeans etc, los cuales venderá a créditos y los cobrará semanlamente. Todo esto lo hará sobre pedidos desus clientes para lograr que la inversión sea muy exitosa. Ella envia el siguiente mensaje a sus finaciadores de Kiva: " Mis agradecimientos con su credito, el cual es muy cómodo y facil de pagar. " Les pido que sigan prestando a muchos clientes".
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Dona, who used her CrediKiva loan to buy merchandise that she sold quickly.  Her customers were very happy with their new shirts, pants and bedspreads.  She is now requesting a new loan to buy small domestic appliances, such as fans and irons, and clothing such as sweaters, jeans, etc.  She will sell them on credit and collect payment weekly.

She will sell the goods based on customer orders so her investment will be successful.  She sends a message to all Kiva lenders that says:  "I am grateful for your loan, which is very comfortable and easy to pay back.  I ask that you continue to loan to many borrowers."

loans.use: To buy small domestic appliances, such as fans and irons, and clothing such as sweaters and jeans, etc.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Olga, quien con su credikiva pudo hacer mejores compras, fabricando bolsos y mochilas que mucho gustaron a su clientela. Ella ha trabajado con mas facilidad, porque teniendo materiales pudo aumentar su producción de hamacas, bolsos y mochilas para proveerles a su clientela. Olga envía el siguiente mensaje a sus finaciadores: "Gracias, el crédito me sirvió de mucho y espero seguir contando con su apoyo. " En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará nuevas artesanías, que agregará a sus nativos productos, como mochilas tipo arhuaco (indígenas que habitan la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta)y accesorios para las mochilas que están muy de modas y se venderán muy rápidamente, haciendo de su nuevo credikiva una exitosa inversión.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Olga who used her CrediKiva loan to makefor better purchases and to make bags and back-packs that her customers liked very much.  She has been working more easily because she had the materials to increase her hammock, bag and back-pag production to supply to her clients.

Olga sends the following message to Kiva lenders;  "Thank you, the loan was very helpful to me and I hope to continue receiving your support."  Currently, she is requesting a new loan to buy new crafts to add to her native products line, such as the typical arhuaco back-pack (from the indians that live in Sierra Nevada in Santa Marta) and back-pack accessories that are in fashion and sell very quickly.  This will make her CrediKiva loan investment successful.

loans.use: To buy new crafts to add to her native products, such as typical aruako back-packs and accessories.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria nació en la comunidad de Mika y vive en la misma comunidad de Mika. (La comunidad de Mika está localizada en el distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 26 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos. 

Maria  es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde siembra papa, cebada, maíz, oca y otras cosas más, ella lleva  a vender sus productos agrícolas una veces a la semana a  las ciudades del Cusco y Huancarani. 

Un grupo de vecinas le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Intipakareq” porque es una persona responsable y alegre. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y chanchos. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Maria was born in the Mika community where she still lives (The Mika community is located in the district of Colquepata in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco, Perú).  She is 26 years old and has a common-law husband and four children.

Maria is a hard-working, enterprising woman who earns a living in agriculture and raising small animals.  She has cropland where she grows potatoes, barley, corn, and other crops which she sells a few time a week in the cities of Cusco and Huancarani.

A group of neighbors invited her to join the communal bank "Intipakareq" because she is a responsible, cheerful person.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.  She is grateful to everyone for the loan and is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Dinorah Maria

texts.es: Dinora, casada madre de 4 hijos, todos mayores de edad unos están estudiando, ella habita en la ciudad de Managua, tuvo muchas limitaciones para poder estudiar pero se hizo la firme promesa de algún dia lograr tener una carrera universitaria. Así lo hizo actualmente este por finalizar la carrera de derecho  estudia durante la noche y en el dia trabaja en una barbería y como secretaria ella divide su tiempo entre sus estudios el trabajo y su familia pues sus hijos  ya son grandes y no dependen mucho de ella su esposo le ayuda con lo que gana aporta para los gastos del hogar  y los estudios de sus hijos pues la situación económica y la escases de trabajo es muy difícil  y sus hijos no trabajan. Por eso  ella escogió esta carrera  para ayudar a su familia a darles una mejor calidad de vida. Ella solicita  el financiamiento  para pagar su curso de titulación y poder obtener su titulo como Abogada,  sus planes futuros es poner su propio buffet  de leyes junto con sus compañeros de la universidad.
texts.en:
Dinora is married and has four adult children, one of whom is studying.  She lives in the city of Managua and had many limitations in getting an education but she made the firm promise that one day she would get a university degree.  That is what she did and now she is finishing her law degree.  She studies at night and during the day works at a barber shop and as a secretary.  She divides her time between studies, work and family, since her children are grown and do not depend on her much.  With what he earns, her husband helps cover household expenses and her children's studies.  Due to the economic situation and unemployment their children do not work.  This is why she chose to study, so she could help her family lead a better lifestyle.  

She is requesting a loan to pay for her last course to get her law degree.  In the future she wants to open a law office with her university colleagues.

loans.use: To pay for a course.

loans.name: Ysidora

texts.es:
Ysidora nació en la comunidad de Pacpapata y vive en la comunidad de Mika. (Las comunidades de Mika y Pacpapata están localizadas en el distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 54 años de edad, es casada por este lazo matrimonial tiene ocho hijos. 

Ysidora es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura, engorde de ganado, venta de ropa americana y crianza de animales menores, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde siembra papa, cebada, maíz, oca y otras cosas más, ella lleva  a vender sus productos agrícolas una veces a la semana a  las ciudades del Cusco y Huancarani. 

Un grupo de vecinas le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Intipakareq” porque es una persona responsable y alegre. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y chanchos. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Ysidora was born in the community of Pacpapata and now lives in Mika. (Mika and Pacapapata are in the Colquepata district, which is part of the Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco, Peru).  Ysidora is 54 years old, married and has eight children with her husband.

Ysidora is an enterprising and hard-working woman who makes a living in agriculture.  She fattens up cows and raises young animals.  She also sells American clothes and has various plots of land where she grows potatoes, barley, corn, oca and other products.  A few times a week she takes her various farming products to the cities of Cusco and Huancarani to sell.

A group of neighbours invited Ysidora to join the "Intipakareq" communal bank because she is a happy and responsible woman.  On this occasion, Ysidora needs a loan to buy young animals such as guinea pigs, hens and pigs.  She thanks everybody for the loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy young animals such as guinea pigs, hens and pigs.

loans.name: Virgen De Carmen Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Mujeres Emprendedoras que lleva por nombre Virgen del Carmen  se encuentra en el 5to. Ciclo del programa de Comité de Mujeres con 20 integrantes actualmente, se  caracteriza por su responsabilidad, excelente cumplimiento en el pago y  participación en las capacitaciones.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora  Maxima de 62 años que se dedica a la venta de comestibles en su copetín hace 30 años aproximadamente, ella todos los días de  la semana sin importar las condiciones del tiempo se levanta a preparar sus chipas, empanadas y milanesas con la ayuda de su marido y luego se traslada a su lugar de ventas. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que quiere seguir luchando para que el día de mañana tenga una vejez digna.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para sus comestibles, como ser carne, harina, huevos, condimentos, y demás, ya que con ello podrá seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
This group of enterprising women goes by the name "Virgen del Carmen" and is on its fifth loan cycle as part of the Women's Committee programme.  The group currently has twenty members, characterised by their sense of responsibility, their excellent reputation for paying off their loans and for their participation in training sessions.

One story worth telling is that of 62 year old Maxima, who has been making a living selling foods from her fast food cart for some 30 years.  Every day, regardless of the weather, Maixma gets up to prepare her "chipas" (a cheesy buns), meat pies and chicken nuggets.  Her husband helps her with this and then she goes out to sell her products.  Maxima is very hard-working and enterpresing and wants to keep fighting so that she can have a decent life.

Maxima is applying for this loan in order to buy supplies such as meat, flour, eggs, condiments and more.  With this she will be able to continue making her sales.

loans.use: to buy meat, flour, eggs, condiments and more.

loans.name: Alirio

texts.es: Alirio desde que recibió su credikiva anterior ha fortalecido su negocio y está construyendo su vivienda poco a poco, por eso agradece a sus financiadores y pide lo sigan apoyando para lograr seguir mejorando su nivel de vida y el de su familia. “Esto estoy muy agradecido con Kiva y con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. “  En la actualidad está aplicando a una nueva financiación, mediante la cual comprará materias primas e insumos para la elaboración de sus frituras, frutas, productos desechables para empacar y equipos de trabajo y hará adecuaciones locativas. Con su inversión proyecta aumentar su clientela, sus ventas y con ello las utilidades de su negocio
texts.en:
Since receiving his previous Kiva loan, Alirio has been able to strengthen his business and build his home a little bit at a time. For this reason, he is grateful to the Kiva lenders and is requesting their continued support so that he can keep improving his standard of living and that of his family. He says, “I am very grateful to Kiva and to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.”

Alirio is currently applying for another loan so that he can buy ingredients and supplies for making fritters, as well as fruit, disposable packing material, and equipment for his work. He will also make structural improvements. With this investment, he expects to increase his clientele, his sales, and his business profits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for making fritters, as well as fruit and disposable packing material.

loans.name: Un Mejor Futuro Group

texts.es: En el Banco Comunal, Un Mejor Futuro, existen distintos rubros como soldadura, peluquería, estilistas, venta de ropa nueva y usada, fabricación y venta de longanizas, entre otros, y Ninoska, que está sentada en primera fila con cartera y zapatos rojos, es estilista. Ella empezó a trabajar como estilista hace cuatro años y empezó trabajando en distintas peluquerías, además de haber estudiado y haberse especializado. Agradece el no tener problemas en su trabajo ni en su familia. Ella ocupará el dinero en comprar y renovar sus implementos de trabajo para tener muchos más clientes. Está muy contenta y pensando positivo en que todo le saldrá bien. Y lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es que la han apoyado incondicionalmente.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Un Mejor Futuro” (A Better Future) engage in various businesses such as welding, managing a beauty salon, hair styling, selling new and used clothing, manufacturing, selling sausages, and other trades.

Ninoska is a stylist. She is seated on the first row with a red purse and shoes. Ninoska started working as a stylist four years ago at various beauty salons. She also studied and became specialized. Ninoska is grateful that she does not have any problems with her work or her family. She will use her loan to buy and replace her work equipment since she has many more clients.

Ninoska is very pleased and is optimistic that everything will turn out well. What she enjoys most about working with Fondo Esperanza is the unconditional support she has received.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her work.

loans.name: Rosiris Margoth

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Rosiris, quien con su anterior credikiva una vez mas aumentó el volumen de sus compras y elaboró nuevas y hermosas hamacas, mochilas  y además compró un cerdo para engordar y  vender por libras. Su credikiva fue muy exitoso, porque aumentó sus posibilidades de comprar nuevos productos y generar un nuevo ingreso vendiendo a precios justos. Ella ha podido hoy ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios y esto la hace muy feliz. Está muy agradecida porque cuenta con un capital para trabajar y espera mejorar su vivienda mas adelante. En la actualidad está aplicando a una nueva financiación mediante la cual comprará materiales constructivos para hacer adecuaciones a su vivienda especialmente en las áreas húmedas que son su mayor desafío.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Rosiris, who was able to use her previous Kiva loan to increase the volume of her sales once again. She made beautiful new hammocks and backpacks, and she also bought a pig to fatten and sell by the pound. 

Her Kiva loan was very successful because she increased her ability to buy new products and generate more earnings while selling at fair prices. She has been able to help her children with their studies, which makes her very happy.

She is very grateful because she has working capital, and she hopes to improve her home in the future. She is currently applying for a new loan to buy construction materials to make improvements to her home, especially in the areas affected by moisture, which are her greatest challenge.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to her home, especially in moist areas.

loans.name: Freddy Raul

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Freddy quien con su credikiva compró materiales con los que fabricó puertas y ventanas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará herramientas como taladros y materiales para tener existencia de productos e impactar a su clientela con nuevos diseños. Freddy envia a sus finaciadores el siguiente mensaje: “Estoy muy agradecido con los prestamos y espero seguir contando con ese apoyo y espero que cuando necesite un monto más alto me puedan ayudar"
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Freddy, who bought materials to make doors and windows with his previous loan. He is currently applying for a Kiva loan to by tools such as drills and materials to have products in stock, making an impact on his clientele with new designs. 

Freddy sends his lenders the following message: "I am very grateful for the loans and I hope to continue counting on this support. I hope that when I need a higher amount you can help me."

loans.use: to buy tools such as drills and materials to have products in stock.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase materials like fabric and thread etc. for her tailoring business.

Natividad has been in this business for six years. Natividad earns more income from buying and selling herbal medicine.

Natividad has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials like fabric and thread etc. for her business

loans.name: Emiro Rafael

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Emiro quien con su credikiva anterior compró una hidrolavadora, y el negocio de lavar motocicletas se ha fortalecido. Hoy está muy contento y aplica a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará otra máquina para lavar  vehículos mucho más moderna y hará de su creditkiva una inversión exitosa. Él dice a sus financiadores: “ Los préstamos han sido un bien para la gente, porque son a bajo interés y cómodos y por eso estoy agradecida con la Fundación. “
texts.en:
Thank you for helping Emiro, who bought a pressure washer and strengthened his motorcycle-washing business with his previous Kiva loan.

Today, he is very happy and he has applied for a new Kiva loan to buy another machine to wash vehicles. This machine will be much more modern and will make his Kiva loan a successful investment. 

He says to his lenders: "These loans have been good for people because they are comfortable and have low interest rates, so I am grateful to the Foundation."

loans.use: to buy a machine to wash vehicles.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a married woman and she has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Panglao, Bohol. Jane runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Her husband operates a motorcycle transport business.

Jane is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle like a wheel, a tire, nuts and bolts, and also additional groceries to sell in her store. Through this they will be able to improve their ventures thus augmenting their income.

loans.use: to buy spare motorcycle parts like a wheel, a tire, nuts and bolts, and additional groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Petronila is 44 years old.

Petronila has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell and for the maintenance of her pump-boat.

Petronila has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell and for the maintenance of her pump-boat

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josphat is married and has five children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

For the past six years, he has operated a poultry selling business. He sells to his neighbours and restaurant operators. His major challenge is the high cost of transportation to his place of operation.

With the Ksh 20,000, he wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 41 years old, married and a father of four children. For the last three years, he has earned a living by selling milk in Malindi. He earns a monthly profit of KES 12,000. 

Dickson was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000 to buy additional dairy equipment, such as milk cans, milking gloves, medicine for his cattle, water cans for the cows to drink from and for his business. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children as well as expand his farming activities. 

Dickson's goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view to increasing his income, so as to help improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase milk cans, water cans and medicine for his dairy cattle

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 59 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Patricia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Patricia has been in pig fattening for 6 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dry goods.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Damdindorj

texts.en:
Mr. Damdindorj, 28 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land.

He has been transporting goods between provinces for two years. Last year he built a house on his land but couldn't move into the new house because of its vulnerable walls and floor. However, due to climate change, the Mongolian winter period is extended and he fears his family will be chilled down to their cores as next winter comes.

So, he is requesting a loan of 6,800,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he can repair and make insulation for his house, thus providing more comfortable and warmer accommodation for his family members because a good quality house is advantageous in many ways compared to a Mongolian traditional ger which is mainly made of felts. More importantly, the renovated house will contribute to the efforts against air pollution because the family will burn less coal thus releasing less smoke into the atmosphere. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Piero Abdon

texts.es:
Piero es un hombre de 28 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Piero no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Carpintería que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Pescado Ahumado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Piero trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de plásticos y artículos para el hogar, como rafias, cintas de embalajes, pegamento, escobillas, escobas, baldes y otros, Piero realiza sus ventas distribuyéndolas en su pequeña movilidad a todos sus clientes, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Piero se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de un pequeño almacén en su vivienda, el cual le servirá de mucho para poder guardar y conservar mejor sus productos, de esta manera Piero tendrá  mejor abastecido su negocio y atender a mas clientes, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran negocio.
texts.en: Piero is 28 years old, single, and lives in the town of Pucalipa. He is a very nice, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, who always wants to do his best. Unfortunately, due to his economic situation and the need to start working at a very young age, Piero was unable to study carpentry, which is what he would have liked to do. In his spare time, he likes to cook a delicious smoked fish dish to share with his family. On his own initiative, sparing no efforts, and with admirable dedication, Piero sells plastics and household items, such as plastic thread, packing tape, glue, brushes, brooms, buckets, and other items. Piero sells door to door in a small radius. He works about ten hours a day and attributes his success to his efforts and his amiability towards customers. Piero is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since, thanks to their help, he will be able to build a small storage room inside his house, which will be very useful to keep his stock for longer. Thus, he will have more products to sell at any time and will be able to tend to more customers. He wants to keep working with all his might towards his great dream of having a big shop.

loans.use: to build a small storage room inside his house.

loans.name: Delia Laura

texts.es:
Delia es una mujer de 38 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Delia no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo al Horno para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Delia trabaja brindando servicios de limpieza en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Delia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de estudios de su sobrina, ya que lamentablemente sus padres son muy humildes y no pueden pagar la matrícula y comprarle sus útiles escolares, de esta manera Delia desea ayudar a su sobrina para que pueda contar una buena educación, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un restaurante propio, para así poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Delia is 32 years old. She is single, and lives in the town of Ica, in the district of Parcona. She is a very nice, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, who always wants to do his best. Unfortunately, due to her economic situation and the need to start working at a very young age, Delia was unable to study agronomy, which is what she would have liked to do. In her spare time, she likes to watch movies, and sometimes cooks a delicious roasted chicken dish, which she shares with her family. On her own initiative, sparing no efforts, and with admirable dedication, Delia works as a cleaning lady in a company in her town. She works every day for about ten hours and attributes her success to her efforts and her amiability towards other people. Delia is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since, thanks to their help, she will be able to pay for her niece's education, since the girl's parents are very poor and cannot afford to pay for school fees nor supplies. Thus, with Delia's help, the girl will be able to go to school. Delia wants to keep working with all her might towards her great dream of having her own restaurant, so as to help her family even more.

loans.use: to pay for her niece's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and fertiliser and to cover watering costs.

loans.name: Cesar Eduardo

texts.es:
Cesar es un hombre de 25 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Cesar no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Cesar trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Cesar se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina, la cual le servirá de mucho, ya que actualmente la cocina de Kerosene que utiliza presenta desperfectos y es peligroso su uso, de esta manera Cesar y su familia podrá preparar de manera más adecuada y segura sus alimentos, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional y al lado de su familia desea poder salir adelante.
texts.en: Cesar is 25 years old. He is single, and lives in the town of Ica, in the district of Parcona, with his parents and siblings. He is a very nice, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, who always wants to do his best. Unfortunately, due to his economic situation and the need to start working at a very young age to help his parents, Cesar was unable to study business administration, which is what he would have liked to do. In his spare time, he likes to watch movies, and sometimes cooks a delicious chicken-and-rice dish called 'arroz con pollo', which he shares with his family. On his own initiative, sparing no efforts, and with admirable dedication, Cesar works as a labourer on a farm belonging to an agricultural union in his town. He works every day for about ten hours and attributes his success to his efforts and his amiability towards other people. Cesar is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since, thanks to their help, he will be able to buy an oven to replace the kerosene-powered stove he is currently using, which is flawed and hazardous. Thus, Cesar and his family will be able to cook in a more safe and secure manner. He wants to keep working towards his great dream of learning a profession and improving both his lot in life and his family's fortunes.

loans.use: to buy an oven.

loans.name: Fredy Felix

texts.es:
Fredy es un hombre de 47 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Fredy no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres, Fredy se dedica a la ganadería, el cuenta con algunas vacas, las cuales cuidad y alimenta para luego vender leche a diversos clientes, trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Fredy se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Fredy se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, la cual actualmente es de esteras y desea reforzar y cubrir el techo de su casa con palos, caña Guayaquil, platicos y otros, antes que inicie la temporada de invierno, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder brindarles seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en: Fredy is 47 years old. He lives in the town of Cañete, in the district of Imperial, with his wife and their four children, whom they love very dearly and who are his main reason for living. He is a very nice, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, who, together with his spouse, spares no efforts to improve his family's lot in life. Unfortunately, due to his economic situation and the need to start working at a very young age to help his parents, Fredy was unable to study and learn a profession, which is what he would have liked to do. In his spare time, he cooks a delicious spicy pork-and-potatoes dish called 'carapulcra con sopa seca' to share with his family. Following his parents' teachings, sparing no efforts, and with admirable dedication, Fredy works as a farmer: he has a few cows, which he feeds and cares for in order to sell milk to various customers. He works every day for about ten hours, likes his work very much and attributes his success to his experience and his amiability towards other people. Fredy is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since, thanks to their help, he will be able to improve his house, which is built out of rush matting. He wants to reinforce it and cover the roof with wooden planks, Guayaquil cane, plastics, and other materials before winter. He will keep working towards his great dream of granting his family safety and a better standard of living.

loans.use: to improve his house.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel nació en la comunidad de Mika y vive  en la misma comunidad donde nació. (La comunidad de Mika está localizada en el distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Él tiene 35 años de edad, es casado por este lazo matrimonial tiene cinco hijos. 

Daniel es un padre emprendedor y trabajador que se dedica a brindar servicio de transportes, a la agricultura, al engorde de ganado, a la elaboración de artesanía y la crianza de animales menores, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde siembra papa, cebada, maíz, oca y otras cosas más. Otra de sus actividades pero que lo realiza en sus horas libres es la elaboración de tejidos como por ejemplo chompas, chalinas, pasadizos y otros. Su mercadería lleva a vender a diferentes ferias de las comunidades de Huancarani.  

Un grupo de vecinas le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Intipakareq” porque es una persona responsable y alegre. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana de alpaca y oveja. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Daniel was born in Mika community and still lives in the same community (Mika community is located in Colquepata district, Paucartambo province, Cusco province, Peru)   Daniel is 35 years old, married and has five children from his marriage.

Daniel is an entrepreneurial and hard-working father who makes a living by providing a transportation service, farming, fattening livestock, making handicrafts and raising animals.  He has several plots of farmland where he grows potatoes, barley, corn, 'oca' (a native tuber) and other crops.  One of his businesses, which he carries out in his free time, is knitting items such as sweaters, scarves, etc.  He takes his merchandise to markets in different communities in Huancarani to sell.

A group of neighbors invited Daniel to join their community bank, called Intipakareq, because he is a responsible and cheerful person.  On this occasion, he needs a loan to buy work materials such as alpaca and sheep's wool.  He is grateful to everybody for the loan and he pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy work materials (alpaca and sheep's wool)

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela nació en la comunidad de Mika pero vive en la comunidad de Sayllapata a treinta minutos de Paucartambo a pie de carretera. (La comunidad de Mika está localizada en el distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 24 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo (Hulver de tres años de edad). 

Adela es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería, artesanía y crianza de animales menores, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora diferentes tipos de tejidos como por ejemplo chompas, chalinas y pasadizos, ella lleva  a vender su  artesanía a diferentes ciudades como Cusco y Huancarani. Su sueño es exportar su sus productos a diferentes países pero también desea abrir una pollería. 
Un grupo de vecinas le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Intipakareq” porque es una persona responsable y alegre. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana de alpaca y de oveja. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
