Adela was born in the village of Mika, but she lives in the village of Sayllapata, thirty minutes away from Paucartambo. (The village of Mika is located in the district of Colquepata, in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru.) She is 24 years old and married with one son, Hulver, who is three years old.

Adela is an enterprising and hardworking woman who makes a living in agriculture, livestock, artisan crafts and raising small animals. She has a small workshop in her home where she makes various types of knitted items, such as sweaters, scarves, and rugs. She sells her artisan crafts in various cities, such as Cusco and Huancarani. Her dream is to export her products to other countries, but she would also like to open a poultry shop.

A group of neighbors invited her to participate in the "Intipakareq" communal bank because she is a happy and responsible person. On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy working material, such as alpaca and sheep wool. She is grateful to everyone for this loan and she is committed to paying her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy working material, such as alpaca and sheep wool.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Marvin tiene la edad de 45 años, es casado y vive con la esposa. El  crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado de cría y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a el y a su familia a salir adelante, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le ha brindaron muchas facilidades. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marvin, 45, is married and lives with his wife. He will use this loan to buy livestock, which he will raise and sell when they are bigger in order to earn an income. 

This livestock business will help him and his family to succeed. He says that the loan committee has helped him very much and they have offered him plenty of flexibility. He hopes that he will grow and achieve his goals with this project, and that in the future he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life and greater financial stability. 

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not had any previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with greater flexibility and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene  57  años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y dos hijos actualmente. Ella con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos para iniciar la siembra de chile, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto de chile  poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
María, 57, is married and lives with her husband and her two children. With this loan, she plans to buy supplies such as fertilizer to begin planting chilis, as well as to help pay labor costs. She would like to maintain her plantations so that they do not suffer from any damage and so that no production is lost. With her chili project, she hopes to generate more earnings to contribute to her family. 

She does not have the necessary capital to make this purchase, since she has a low income and does not have a way to acquire the necessary money. Therefore, she has applied for a loan, which is her first with FUDECOSUR. She has not had any previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with greater flexibility and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant chilis.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile is 30 years old. She owns a bar and has been in this business for three years. She wants this loan to buy more beers and sodas for resale. With the profits from the business she will reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ousmane est un homme marié de 43 ans et père de 5 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants à Bougouni, dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord.
Après l’école coranique, il est resté longtemps sans emploi.
C’est ainsi qu’après mure réflexion, il décide d’apprendre auprès de son oncle la commercialisation des appareil électroniques.
Avec une expériences de plus de 5 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
Dans le cadre du renforcement de ses activités, il décide d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso qu’il a connu à travers une cliente pour prendre un prêt. Il a pris 3 prêts et tous ont été bien remboursé. Avec ce nouveau prêt il compte acheter 40 radios, 10 torches et quelques cartons de piles.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako et la vente se fait dans les différents marchés de Bougouni. Sa clientèle est mixte. Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Ousmane  is a 43-year-old married man and a father of five children. He lives with his wife and their children in Bougouni, in the Heremakono Nord neighborhood. After Koranic school, he was unemployed for a long time. So, after some reflection, he decided to learn from his uncle the business of selling electronics. 

He has been conducting this type of business [now] for more than five years. In order to increase his business, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program, which he heard about from a customer. He has taken out three loans and they have all been correctly repaid. 

With this new loan, he plans to buy 40 radios, 10 flashlights, and some packets of batteries. He procures his goods in Bamako and he sells his products in different markets in Bougouni. He serves a mixed group of customers. 

With this loan, he hopes to earn an average monthly income of 45,000 francs CFA, which will be used to support his family's needs and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric is a 51-year-old man from Muhanga District, in the Southern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of RWF 180,000 to purchase 60 rechargeable, LED lights, which he will resell to people in his village who are without electricity. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Eric started selling lights in April, 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a shop keeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife and the extended family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay for 60 low-cost, rechargeable, LED lights, which he will resell to rural households that lack electricity.

loans.name: Tan - Gao Group

texts.fr: Le groupe TAN - GAO est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Ruth Olga Chakinatou, âgée de 28 ans, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Ruth Olga Chakinatou est mariée à Eugène, un commerçant. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Ruth Olga Chakinatou et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Ruth Olga Chakinatou a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Il y a cinq ans que  Ruth Olga Chakinatou exerce comme activité, la vente d'huile végétale et des produits divers(lait, sucre, biscuits, etc.) à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Ruth Olga Chakinatou désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Ruth Olga Chakinatou sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe TAN - GAO , un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Tan-Gao Group is made up of three women who are friends. The group's leader, Ruth Olga Chakinatou, is 28 years old and is the woman with her hand raised in the photo. She is married to Eugène, a shopkeeper. The couple has three children, some of whom attend school and all of whom are in their care. Ruth Olga Chakinatou and her husband live with their children and see to the various household expenses together. Ruth Olga Chakinatou attended school until high school.

For five years, Ruth Olga Chakinatou has been running a business selling vegetable oil and assorted goods (milk, sugar, cookies, etc.) from her home. This allows her to meet the needs of her family without too much trouble. In the hope of better meeting customer demand, she wants to strengthen her business. In order to do so, Ruth Olga Chakinatou, along with the other members of Tan-Gao Group, is seeking her first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable oil and assorted goods (sugar, milk, cookies, etc.).

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 5 children ranging in age from 2 to 22. She operates a used clothes retail store where she sells used clothes to customers. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge as low borrower purchasing power. She will use this 60,000 KES loan to add stocks of clothes to her retail store. Her business goal is to expand to other towns within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a supplier of clothes. This is the clients's third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to add stocks of clothes to her retail store.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis, 31, is a married man with one child. He has been in the business of selling cereals for 1.5 years. His business is located within town and has high potential. His customers are mostly locals from the area in which he operates. He has borrowed a loan of 20,000 KES which he will use to buy more maize and beans to sell; with his profits, he will pay off his loan and expand his business. Previously, he has been involved in farming business. This is the second loan with SMEP DTM; the previous loan was repaid successfully. His future goals are to supply cereals to institutions and sustain his business.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 41 years old, married and a mother of three children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling cereals to residents of Malindi town. She earns a monthly profit of KES. 10,000. 

Martha was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her second loan of KES. 20,000, to buy additional stock of cereals for her business such as beans, maize grains, and cow peas to sell to her customers. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beans, maize grains, and cow peas.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a dressmaker from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has four children. Anecita is asking for a loan to buy cloth, thread, needles and other items. 

Through this loan, she will be able to sew and make more dresses, thus increasing her output and eventually her income. In the future, Anecita has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, needles and other items.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 53 years old, married and has two children. 

Norma is in the agricultural hog-raising business in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 20000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Norma has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to sustain it.

Norma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Veton

texts.en:
Veton is 21 years old and single. He lives in the southern part of Kosovo with his entire family. Veton used to sell bicycles for other companies. His salary was very low and was not enough to cover his family's daily expenses. Veton now started to open his own bicycle store. He is a very hardworking person and very ambitious.
Veton requests a loan to buy bicycles to sell. The loan will help him to improve living conditions for his family. Veton is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping to improve his business conditions and standard of living!

loans.use: To buy bicycles to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support her family. She is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Conchita requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Conchita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Conchita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her largest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past five years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Luciana dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With her requested loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a married man with no children. He has been in the M-pesa business, a mobile phone-based money-transfer service, for four years. His business is located in town where there are enough customers. The business targets all types of customers. The challenge he faces is lack of enough float.
Vincent has borrowed a loan of 20,000 KES which he intends to use to expand his business. He plans to use the anticipated profits to open another M-pesa shop. Vincent describes himself as independent. His future goal is to have 10 M-pesa businesses.

loans.use: to expand his M-pesa business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 43 years old, married and a mother of three children. She operates a cafe for a living in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of about KES 5,000. 

Beatrice applied for a loan of KES 15,000 to buy more stock of food supplies such as cooking flour, cooking oil, cereals, and beans, as well as other items such as spoons, eating plates, tea cups, etc. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

Beatrice intends to continue growing her business and hopes that one day that she will come to own a well established hotel in the area.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, cereals, beans and other items such as spoons, plates and tea cups

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en: Aurea runs a sari-sari, or variety store, business selling various goods and items to the people in Getafe, Bohol. Aurea is asking for a loan to buy additional stock of canned goods, candies, soda, and beverages to sell. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers, thus increasing her sales and income. Aurea hopes to expand her store in the future so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of her family and for reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, candies, soda, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Elsa works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs. Elsa is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell. Elsa has been sustaining her business activities with her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a "videoke" (musical entertainment) business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business, and an additional videoke machine. Luzviminda has been in this business for 10 years. Luzviminda earns additional income from a restaurant. Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business, and an additional videoke (musical entertainment) machine.

loans.name: Jamol

texts.en: Jamol is married and has one child who is small and doesn’t go to school. His wife is a very hard-working woman, but she has no income, as she is a housewife. She has been busy raising children. Jamol loves his family and tries to provide his family with good living conditions. This is why that began his own driving business one year ago. He tries to give perfect service and thus to attract more clients. He is asking for a loan to repair his car. In this way, his business will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income, which will allow him to offer his child and his wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: to repair the car he uses in his business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and blessed with five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Joyce cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites food leftovers leading to losses as being her major challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the KES 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rosine

texts.en:
Rosine, 43, is married with two children, one who is in school. 

She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 14 years. She is seen here at the stand where her food is displayed. 

Rosine has requested a loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase meat, hotdogs and other foods to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase meat, hotdogs and other foods to sell

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.en:
Firdavs has run an animal husbandry business since 2006. There are five people in his family. He lives with his wife, one child, and his parents. His wife is a housewife who has no income.
 
Since last year, Firdavs has been repairing his house. There is still some work to be done to finish it completely. He wants to repair all the rooms of his old house. The loan of 3,000 USD will be used to purchase some missing building materials for repairing his family's house. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing house

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 43 years old, married and has three children who are in school. 

Bernadeth is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Bernadeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Bernadeth has been pig-fattening for a year now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Bernadeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Atieno

texts.en:
Atieno is a single mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 62 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Elisa is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Elisa has been pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en: Ma. Cecilia works hard to support her family. Ma. Cecilia is married and has a business buying and selling fruit in the Philippines. Ma. Cecilia applied for a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fruit to sell. Ma. Cecilia has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Ma. Cecilia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn works hard to support her family. Marilyn is married and has a general store in the Philippines. Marilyn applied for a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as bread, shampoo, soft drinks, snack foods and other groceries. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her general store business. Marilyn has been in this business for seven years and also earns additional income from food vending. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store, such as bread, shampoo, soft drinks, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.en:
Abdukodir, 42, is married with three children, whose ages range from 11 to 20 years old.

For six years, Abdukodir has been busy with repairing cars. Thanks to his good experience in this field, and his influence with his suppliers, he has been able to earn more income. That income, however, does not allow him to provide for the needs of his family as well as repair his house.

His family is large and needs to big, comfortable house. This year, he is going to repair the house with modern planning. He plans to repair two bedrooms, a large living room, verandah and kitchen. 

This loan will help him buy building materials to repair the house. With these repairs, Abdukodir will provide a high quality of life for his family and put an end to the problems with the house.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his house

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase additional equipment for her business.

Violeta has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal and rice grains.

Violeta has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for her manicure business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support four children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Violeta requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. 

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Violeta is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Dodo

texts.en:
Dodo is 50 years old. She lives in Khobi District with her sister and mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Dodo requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is the monthly pension of Dodo’s mother. In total, it is 125 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Dodo requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Dodo has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Dodo will begin to trade clothing. She plans to purchase clothing in Turkey and then resell it in Khobi district. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin to trade clothing.

loans.name: Mamurjon

texts.en:
Mamurjon is a 40-year-old man, married and the father of five children.

He has been busy with taxi driving for five years. Thanks to the good service he provides, he has his own clients. Mamurjon tries to provide his family with good living conditions. He wants to repair his house. Especially he wants to repair the roof of his house as it is in a bad condition and it always rains in his region. 

He is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy slate and wood. This loan will help him to repair roof of his house. In this way he will provide high quality living conditions to his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy slate to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man with two children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

He has operated a retail shop business for the past 10 years, selling consumable goods like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. He faces a major challenge of creditors staying long enough to repay goods taken on credit. 

With the loan he is requesting, Patrick wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 62 years old, and married with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Rosalinda has a banana and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bananas and vegetables to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a gravestone-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy marble, granite and other materials for her business.

She has been in this business for 30 years and earns additional income from food vending. She has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy marble, granite and other materials for her business

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David operates a poultry selling business. He sells to his neighbours and passersby. His major challenge is the high cost of transportation in his place of operation.

With the KES 15,000 he wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and improve his living standards David is very appreciative of the previous Kiva loan which enabled him to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
This is Pamela. Her previous loan was a big help in her clothing business. She was able to improve her business, which she has been in for years and keeps growing. 

Pamela would like to apply for another loan, this time for 40,000 Kenyan shillings, to pay school fees for her children who attend school. She looks forward to this loan with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (a young sister). She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for three years selling to all categories of people but on retail six days out of every week. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through a retail shop. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to get enough profits so as to build her house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major costs include school fees, feeding the family and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. He describes himself to be ambitious. 

David operates a motorbike transport business where he provides transport services to customers using a motorbike. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a convenient area with regular customers, and his primary customers are regular and first-time clients. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorbike. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is the client’s first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motor bike.

loans.name: Hernanita

texts.en: Hernanita works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines. Hernanita requested a 4,600 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good lightsource that is waterproof during the rainy season. Hernanita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Maritess works hard to support her family. She has a soft drink retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and buying and selling recycled materials. 

Maritess is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of soft drinks to sell for her soft drink retail business.

Maritess has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Desde muy joven,  Gladys acompañó a su padre en la actividad comercial y de él aprendió todo lo que hoy sabe respecto a las ventas, tarea en la que hoy se desempeña  y genera ingresos comercializando  ropa, calzado y accesorios. Su  idea de negocio inició hace 28 años y aun no se detiene y presenta un importante potencial de crecimiento. 
Gladys tiene como clientes mujeres y hombres que son vecinos y referidos por estos, a quienes les vende a crédito,  mediante plazos cortos, en una frecuencia que va de  lunes a sábados y desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Su meta más adelante, es tener un almacén en el que ofrezca todos los artículos que su clientela requiera, en función de satisfacer sus necesidades, deseos e intereses, mientras ella gana dinero. En la actualidad está solicitando un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará bolsos, calzado para caballeros y ropa para damas, que han sido encargados por su clientela. Con esta inversión, incrementará su capital de trabajo y tendrá mayor efectivo disponible,  para hacer compras  de artículos con beneficios de precios, pues lo hace en mayor volumen y a la medida de los requerimientos de sus compradores y esto es justamente lo que hace que su inversión sea exitosa ..
texts.en:
Starting when she was a child,  Gladys accompanied her father during his commercial activities. She learned all that she knows today from him regarding sales, lessons that serve her well today and generate revenue from selling clothing, shoes and accessories. Her idea for the business began 28 years ago and still has not stopped and it presents important potential for growth today.

Gladys's customers are women and men who are her neighbors and others referred to her by them. She makes her sales on credit through small installments and works Mondays through Saturdays from 7 in the morning to 7 at night. Her most important goal is to have a store in which to offer all of the items that her clients request so she can satisfy their needs, desires and interests, while she earns money. Today she is seeking a loan from Kiva, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy purses, shoes for men and clothing for women that have been ordered by her customers. With this investment, she will increase her working capital and will have more cash on hand to make purchases of items at good prices which will increase her volume while meeting the requirements of her buyers. This is what makes her investment exciting.

loans.use: to buy purses, men's shoes and clothing for women.

loans.name: Azizjon

texts.en: Azizjon is a 21-year-old man. He is not married and lives with his parents. He is a very hardworking and smart man. For more than seven months he has been busy with driving a taxi. He tries to develop his business and use the profits to improve his family's living conditions. A few months ago, he decided to repair his house, as his house is in a bad condition. He does not have money to buy building materials for repairing the house. That’s why he is asking for a loan of 500 USD to buy building materials. He awaits your support and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing his house

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 31 year old married man. He has four children aged between one and six years. He has been operating a water business for five years. He plans to use the loan to pay school fees for his children and also buy an oxen cart. Peter is a talkative man and hopes to have a tuk tuk (motorized cart) to supply water in five years time. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He also earns extra income farming.

loans.use: to educate his children and buy an oxen cart

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 62 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Merlinda has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Merlinda has requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Merlinda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Merlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.

He has operated a retail business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has 5 children who range in age from 10 years to 26 years. She describes herself to be a go getter. She operates a livestock farm where she produces milk to sell to customers and neighboring community members. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of animal feed. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy fodder and animal medication. Her goal is to buy more cows for her dairy business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be wealthy and stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was paid back successfully.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her animals

loans.name: Mariejoe

texts.en:
Mariejoe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Mariejoe has been in this business for 5 years. Mariejoe earns more income from a general store.

Mariejoe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a single mother of three children all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are electricity bills and the high cost of transportation.

For the past eight years she has operated a fresh water business selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other water providers. She dreams of establishing another water distribution point in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase a water pump for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump for her business

loans.name: Glory Stella

texts.en:
Glory Stella is 44 years old, married, and has one child, who is in school. 

Glory Stella has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF 29 times in the past to sustain her business. She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Glory Stella has requested PHP 29,000 to buy feeds, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Glory Stella would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old, married, and has three children. 

She lives in the Philippines and works in agriculture, fattening pigs. Maria requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs. Maria has been fattening pigs for 4 years, and she has borrowed from NWTF 6 times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Maria would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine  is married with three children and two of them go to school. She also takes care of her young sister. For the past four years, Justine has run a beauty salon. She works seven days a week and works out of a rented shop. Justine's major business challenges include seasonality and on-and-off electricity. She lives with her family in her own house and has access to running water and electricity. Justine's monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

Justine is applying for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more braids, weaves, and hair oils. In the future, she aspires to own a fully-stocked beauty salon and build rental rooms.

loans.use: to buy braids, weaves, and hair oils

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is coming to Yehu for another Kiva loan of Kes 50,000. His previous loan enabled him to increase his profits and reinvest in his business. With this one, Jonathan wants to renovate his rental house by purchasing cement, sand and wall paints. He is grateful for the opportunity Yehu and Kiva lenders have provided to access loans.

loans.use: in purchasing cement, sand and wall paints.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 36-year-old tailor in Kilifi, Kenya. He is a married man whose spouse is also a tailor, and together they support their three children. He has been in this business for the last nine years and has done great. 

This marks his fifth borrowing to finance his business. He will use the requested money to buy sewing thread, clothing material and an overlock machine for his shop. 


The anticipated profit will pay help Mohamed pay school fees for his children. He hopes to succeed in all his future projects.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing thread, clothing material and an overlock machine.

loans.name: Laureano

texts.es: Laureano tiene 27 años de edad y se dedica a la comercialización de carnes frías y productos naturales. Desde hace 10 años cuando tenía 17 años, él ya  trabajaba  como empleado, pero quedó cesante y para generar ingresos propios, decidió emprender su aventura de negocios, apoyado por la experiencia de un amigo, quien tenía mucho conocimiento del mercado en el que incursionaría.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado, así como sus compras, las cuales hace en el mercado de la ciudad, donde encuentra precios competitivos, para llevar a sus clientes las mejores opciones de acceso a sus productos. Su  principal  clientela son las tiendas  de barrios y particulares que han sido referidos por familiares y vecinos. Su meta es la de incrementar sus ganancias, vendiendo mucho mas, pero su mayor desafío, es tener el capital suficiente para impactar su mercado y ampliar la oferta de sus productos. Esto es justamente lo que logrará con su credikiva, al que está aplicando y es su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará salchichones, salchichas y otros embutidos, además de productos naturales para la gripe y para terapias celular multiembrionaria. Todo esto con el fin de lograr capitalizar su negocio,  incrementando sus ventas, para que la inversión sea muy exitosa.
texts.en: Laureano is 27 years old and he works selling chilled meats and natural products. Starting 10 years ago, when he was 17, he was already working, but he was let go from his job. To earn his own money, he decided to begin an adventure in business with support from an experienced friend who had a lot of knowledge of the market in which he would explore. His sales are conducted in cash, as are his purchases, which he makes in the market in the city where he finds competitive prices in order to bring to his clients the best options for accessing his products. His primary clients are neighborhood stores, particularly those that have been referred to him by family or neighbors. His goal is to increase his earnings by selling more items, but his biggest challenge is to have sufficient capital to impact his market and to increase his offerings of his products. This is what he will accomplish with the Kiva loan that he is applying for. This is his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he will use to buy pepperoni, sausages and other meats in addition to natural remedies for colds and for cellular therapy. He will do all of this with the goal of capitalizing his business and increasing his sales so that the investment will be very successful.

loans.use: to buy pepperoni, sausages and other meats in addition to natural remedies for colds and for cellular therapy.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 37-year-old married woman with 6 children. She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans, tomatoes, and potatoes to sell. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a favorable climate zone that is good for farming. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her crops. Esther hopes that, in the future, she will be able to buy more farmland to grow crops. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 46 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling milk in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. 

Rachel was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000 to buy additional dairy equipment such as milk cans, milking gloves, and water cans for the cows to drink from. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as to expand her farming activities. Rachel's goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming, with a view toward increasing her income in order to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase milk cans, milking gloves, and medicine for her dairy business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, a 48-year-old widowed mother of four children ranging in age from 16 years to 27 years, describes herself as ambitious. For the past 10 years Monica has been operating a clothing retail store. Her business is located in a viable location with plenty of customers.

Describing her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital for expansion, Monica has requested this Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her goal is to expand within five years, and she hopes that in the future she will excel in the business. This will be Monica's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Hermosilia

texts.en:
Hermosilia is 52 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Hermosilia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy additional livestock to sell.

Hermosilia has been raising livestock for 13 years and also earns additional income from tobacco vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 29 years old, married and a mother of four children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling goods at her general store in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES. 7,000. 

Lilian is applying for her second loan of KES. 10,000, to buy additional stock for her shop such as cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, and cooking flour to sell to her customers. She will use the profits to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her business.

Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, and cooking flour.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 44 years old, married, and has four children who are all in school.

Irene is in the agricultural business, hog raising in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Irene has been in this business for 12 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Irene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 36 years old with two children. She has been running her hair salon for a period of about five years with an income of about  KES. 30,000 a month.

She is taking her fourth loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying her previous loan well. She will use the loan to buy salon equipment such as a hair drier and blow drier. 

She hopes to expand her beauty salon. She also hopes to give her children quality education.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment such as a hair drier and blow drier.

loans.name: Deory

texts.en:
Deory works hard to support five children. She is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Deory requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Deory is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. Melanie is married and has a sari sari store business in the Philippines.

Melanie is borrowing PHP 4,600 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Melanie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support five children. She is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.

Rosita requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Rosita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Sony is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a trisikad (bicycle taxi) business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase an additional trisikad. Sony has been in this business for 6 years. She earns additional income by buying and selling recycled materials.

Sony has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional trisikad for her bicycle taxi business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 40 years old and married with four children. She lives in the Philippines and earns a living by raising pigs. Mary Ann has been raising pigs for 2 years, and she also earns additional income from rice retailing.

Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 23 years old, married, and the mother of one child. For the last year, she has earned a living by selling clothes in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 4,000. 

Saumu was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She is applying for her first loan, in the amount of KES 10,000, to buy additional stock for her business, such as dresses, blouses, trousers, and shirts. 

Saumu will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her child as well as to expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy dresses, blouses, trousers, and shirts to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a 23-year-old married man who has one child. For the past two years, he has operated a gas station where he sells gas and fuel to customers. Alexander's business is located in a viable location with plenty of customers. This is his second loan request with SMEP DTM. He successfully repaid his previous loan. Alexander's biggest business challenge is the lack of enough capital to expand business.  

Alexander is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more gas for his business. His business goal is to expand within five years. In the future, Alexander also hopes to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy fuel to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a married man aged thirty nine years. He runs a retail shop where he sells products such as maize flour, sugar, cooking oil etc The shop is located in a busy area and most of the customers are the local residents. He plans to use the loan to buy stock, eg., cooking oil and sugar for sale. Paul hopes to own a wholesale business in five years time.  This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. The previous ones he has been able to to repay successfully. He is a determined man.

loans.use: buy more stock, eg., cooking oil and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Mwarabu

texts.en:
Mwarabu lives at his own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a food stall business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. His potential customers are neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. 

With the loan that he is requesting of Kes 50,000, he wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela de 60 años habita en la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a vender productos mediante guías especializadas o catálogos desde el año 1998. Su negocio inició cuando consideró que era necesario dedicarse a alguna actividad para ayudar en los gastos de su hogar y apoyar a su esposo quien es un vendedor de pescados. Los productos de su oferta son las cremas, colonias, perfumes, desodorantes cosméticos entre otras mercancías que vende a crédito y que compra de contado. Ángela visita diariamente a su clientela y atiende su negocio desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Su meta más adelante es abrir un local al público y terminar de educar a su hija menor, por eso su meta actual es aumentar sus ventas y su mayor desafío es contar con el capital de trabajo suficiente para lograrlo. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un creidikiva, prime financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos que le ha encargado su clientela como productos de tocador y de aseo personal. Con esta inversión se proyecta que Angela aumente su capacidad de compra, incremente su oferta de productos  y generar nuevas utilidades, para hacer de su creidikiva una inversión exitosa
texts.en:
Ángela, age 60, lives in the city of Barranquilla.  She has been selling products through specialized guides and catalogs since the year 1998.  She started her business when she believed it was necessary to work at some business activity in order to help with the household expenses and to support her husband, who sells fish.

The products that she offers are creams, colognes, perfumes, deodorants, and cosmetics, among other merchandise.  She sells on credit, and she buys for cash.  Ángela visits her clientele daily.  She tends to her business from eight in the morning until six in the evening.

Her goal for later on is to open a place to the public and to finish her minor daughter’s education.  Therefore, her current goal is to increase her sales.  Her greatest challenge is having sufficient working capital in order to manage to do so.

That is exactly the reason that she turns to a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy products that her customers have ordered.  She will buy toiletries and personal hygiene products.

With this investment Ángela plans to increase her purchasing capacity, to increase her offer of products, and to generate new profits.  She will do this in order to make her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy toiletries and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Nana Yaw

texts.en:
Nana Yaw is a small-scale grocery seller in Aburaman Nkwanta (near Cape Coast). As a middle-level graduate, he has had some formal education. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a trader.

Nana Yaw has been working as a grocery store attendant for close to 13 years. His income is used to help his wife pay their utility bills and their children’s school fees. He plans on using his loan to purchase an increased quantity of groceries, thus allowing him to meet rising customer demand. He hopes to use the profits from his enterprise to fulfill his dream of buying a grocery stand, which would allow him to sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of groceries

loans.name: Muhudin

texts.en:
This is Muhudin. His previous loan was a big help to his business by allowing him to expand his rental houses. He has been renting properties for years now, and the business keeps on growing. 

Muhudin would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of KES 50,000, to buy furnishings, cement, and wall paints for his rental houses. The profits from his business help him to sustain his daily needs and pay for his children's education. He looks forward to the anticipated financial boost made possible by this loan with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

loans.use: purchase furniture, cement, and wall paints for his rental houses.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is 39 years old and married with two children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling milk in Malindi. Dama earns a monthly profit of 4,000 KES. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her second loan.

Dama is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to buy additional stock of milk for her business. She will also buy new milk cans to store her milk. Dama will use the profits from her loan to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her business. Her future goal is to continue to expand her business to help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to purchase milk and milk cans

loans.name: Anamae

texts.en:
Anamae is 30 years old and married with two children who are in school. For the past six years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. Anamae works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid 15 previous loans from NWTF.

Anamae is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, soap, shampoo, egg, spices, and other items. In the future, she aspires to save enough money to afford to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soap, shampoo, egg, spices, and other items

loans.name: Konstantine

texts.en:
Konstantine is 21 years old. He lives in the small village of Lagodekhi District with his mother. Konstantine requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milking cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides, they have 3 hectares of agricultural land, where cucumbers, maize, aborigine and watermelons are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Konstantine requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Konstantine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit Konstantine will purchase a minibus. After purchasing a minibus, he plans to trade with vegetables and increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and trade with vegetables.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Janet works hard to support her family.

She has a direct-selling personal collection products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Janet is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like lotion, laundry soap, shampoo, etc. to sell for her direct-selling personal collection products business.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like lotion, laundry soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Josiecora

texts.en:
Josiecora works hard to support her family. Josiecora is widowed and has a beauty salon business in the Philippines.

Josiecora requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products for her business.

Josiecora has been in this business for 14 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her beauty salon business.

In the future, Josiecora would like to save enough enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has a child who is 3 and half years old. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a beauty salon where she sells hair pieces and hair chemicals to customers and also treatment of hair. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a viable location with plenty of customers and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital to expand business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more hair chemicals and hair pieces for her business. Her business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, to open a beauty parlor. This is the clients first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy hair pieces and hair products for her business.

loans.name: Mirembe

texts.en:
Mirembe, a married mother of three children, two of whom attend school, resides in a rented house with her family. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees. For 12 years now, she has operated a retail shop, and generates additional income from selling passion juice.

Mirembe has applied for a loan of 300000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, small jerrycans of cooking oil and boxes of Safi soft drinks. Her business challenges include transportation and ever-increasing prices of Ugandan commodities. She aspires to own a wholesale shop and also to build her own shop.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and small jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is coming to Yehu for a new Kiva loan of 45,000 Kenyan shillings. He managed to increase profits from his previous loan and reinvested back into his business. With this loan, he wants to purchase cement, sand and wall paints to enable him to construct his house. He is grateful for the opportunity Yehu and Kiva lenders have provided to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and wall paints to enable him to construct his house.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 53 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 9 hijos, de los cuales solo cuatro viven con ella. La señora se caso cuando tenía 16 años de edad; pero su esposo murió hace 9 años de causas naturales, desde entonces ella es padre y madre para sus hijos. Desde muy joven su madre le enseño a elaborar pan y tamales, actividad que realiza hasta la fecha pues no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar; los tamales y el pan los vende cada tres o dos días a la semana, los vende en la comunidad donde vive y también por encargo.

Para elaborar los tamales ella compra las hojas a un tío, las gallinas ella las posee y los condimentos los adquiere en la comunidad; para elaborar el pan tiene que desplazarse a  la ciudad para comprar la harina, levadura, huevos, azúcar, etc., camina a pie durante veinte minutos y luego aborda un autobús que tarda veinticinco minutos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar seis sacos de maíz para consumo familiar y para elaborar los tamales, hojas de huerta, harina, huevos, azúcar, levadura, entre otros insumos más. De esta manera, tendrá disponible suficientes insumos para elaborar su venta y salir a vender para obtener ingresos que le permitan ahorrar y brindarle a sus hijos el estudio Universitario ya que esta en este momento a nivel básico.
texts.en: María is 53 years old. She is a widow and has nine children, of whom only four live with her. She married when she was sixteen, but her husband died nine years ago of natural causes, and she has been mother and father to their children since then. When María was very young, her mother taught her how to make bread and tamales, a trade she still practices nowadays, as she was not fortunate enough to go to school. She sells her products in her neighbourhood two or three days a week, and sometimes customers order beforehand. To make tamales, she needs to buy the leaves to a producer and the condiments in her neighbourhood; the hens she breeds herself. To make bread, she needs to go to the city to buy the necessary flour, leavening agent, eggs, sugar, etc. She needs to walk for twenty minutes in order to catch a bus which leaves her in the city in twenty-five. The loan she asks the field partner for she will use to buy six sacks of sweetcorn in order to prepare food to eat at home as well as tamales to sell. In this way, she will have all the ingredients she needs for her business, from which she derives her livelihood. She hopes her income will be enough to enable her to put some money aside to pay for her children's studies once they are old enough to go to university.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of sweetcorn in order to prepare food, both to eat at home and to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 52 years old and married with six children. Ma. Luz works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Luz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like noodles, biscuits, sugar, bread, canned goods, etc., to sell in her general store.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, biscuits, sugar, bread, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like noodles, biscuits, sugar, bread, canned goods, etc., to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 26 years old, married and a mother of six children. She sells fish in Malindi for a living, where she earns a monthly income of about 6,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).

Janet was introduced to KADET LTD. by our credit officer, and at the moment, she needs funds which she was lacking in order for her to purchase additional stock for her business. 

The loan of 10,000 KES given to Janet will allow her to purchase additional stock of fish for sale. Janet intends to continue growing her business and hopes that one day, she will come to own a well-established fish depot in the area.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a dairy

loans.name: Nkirimpa

texts.en:
Nkirimpa, now a father of three, has successfully paid up his previous loan. Owing to the plenty of animal feeds in this rainy season the business is doing great.

He has asked for his second loan of KES. 100,000 which he will use to buy more sheep and goats to fatten for sale.

He plans to use the increased proceeds to pay college fees for his children who are almost completing high school. His dream is to see his family prosper.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and goats to fatten for sale.

loans.name: Manuel José

texts.es: Manuel de 19 años, tiene 2 años de experiencia como comerciante de productos variados, el el vende  cosméticos ropa y calzado principalmente. Su actividad comercial se deriva de la que realizaron sus padres, quienes le enseñaron desde muy niño esta tarea y poco a poco lo apoyaron en el fortalecimiento de su propio capital. Manuel ha ganado una clientela fija, que hace pedidos permanentes y muchas veces su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para cubrir la demanda, pues vende a crédito el mayor volumen de sus productos y su expectativa de crecimiento, es superior a sus posibilidades de hacerlo por si solo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará electrodomésticos, ropa, calzado y perfumería, productos que han solicitado sus clientes y que poco a poco le ayudaran en el crecimiento de su negocio, para lograr una estabilidad económica y podrá seguir estudiando para ser muy exitoso en el futuro.
texts.en:
Manuel is nineteen years old and has two years of experience as a tradesman selling various products.  He principally sells cosmetics, clothing, and footwear.  This commercial activity is derived from that of his parents, who taught him this work from a young age.  Little by little, they supported him in strengthening his own capital.  

Manuel has won a fixed clientele, and they make standing orders.  However, his working capital is insufficient to cover this demand a lot of the time, and he sells the majority of his products on credit.  His expectation for growth is greater with help than if he works alone.  This is the reason that he requests a loan. 

This is his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will buy electronic household appliances, clothing, footwear, and perfumes - these are the products that his clients have requested.  Little by little, this will help him in growing his business, and he will be able to attain a stable economic situation and to continue studying in order to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy electronic household appliances, clothing, footwear, and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be trustworthy. He operates a clothing retail store where he sells clothes to customers. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a location with plenty of customers and his primary customers are men. He describes his biggest business challenge to be rain and dust which make it imposible to sell clothes. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. His business goal is to be an employer within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, will expand his business. This is the client's second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell for his business.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: Loice is a hard working woman who thanks her efforts. She appreciates Kiva and Yehu for their support which has enabled her improve her living standards and her family at large.She comes to you again asking for a loan of Kshs 100,000 to install electricity in her rental houses and purchase doors for her rental houses.

loans.use: to install electricity in her rental houses and purchase doors for her rental houses.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 32-year-old married woman with three children ranging from two to seven years old. For the past two years, she has operated a pharmacy where she sells medicine to customers. Annah describes herself as trustworthy. Her business is located in an area with plenty of customers and her primary customers are patients. Annah's biggest business challenge is the lack of capital to expand her business. This will be her second loan with SMEP DTM. Annah repaid her previous loan successfully. 

Annah is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy more medicine for her pharmacy. Her business goal is to open another pharmacy within five years. In the future, Annah hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her pharmacy

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. She runs a vegetable stall.

Mwanajuma is requesting a loan to start another business selling charcoal. She will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. Mwanajuma is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en:
Kazungu is 34 years old, married and a father of four children. For the last four years, he has earned a living by selling goods at his general store in Malindi. He earns a monthly profit of KES.18,000. 

Kazungu was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for his third loan of KES. 70,000, to buy additional stock for his shop such as cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, and cooking flour for sale. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children as well as expand his business. 

His goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that he may uplift his financial stability and provide his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, and maize flour.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a married man who is 41 years old. He has has five children between the ages of 10 months and 5 years. He operates a retail shop and has been in this business for three years. His customers are the local residents. Benson faces a challenge of  lack of sufficient funds to run the shop.  Benson plans to use the loan to  buy more stock for sale. He plans to use the anticipated profits to grow the business and support his family as well. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. He was able to repay the previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock for sale such as maize flour, sugar, and bread

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina tiene 43 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos pero solo tres viven junto a ella. Desde hace cinco años se dedica a la venta de ropa; aprendió esta actividad, porque su madre la desempeñaba, igual que sus hermanas. Antes Valentina, elaboraba tamales, pan, pastelitos y enchiladas para vender en su comunidad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar ropa interior de niños, ropa interior de adultos, chinas para hombre y mujer y zapatos. Para diversificar la mercadería que ofrece a sus clientes y mejorar los precios; con el objetivo de que sus ingresos incrementen y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su deseo es comprar un local en el mercado para no seguir vendiendo de manera ambulante y realizar mejorar a su vivienda para que sus hijos vivan en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Valentina is 43 years old. She has four children, of whom only three live with her. She has been selling clothes for five years, a trade she learned from her mother, as did her sisters. Before, Valentina made tamales, bread, savouries, and enchiladas, which she sold in her town. The loan she asks the field partner for she will use to buy undergarments for children and adults, clothes for men and women, and shoes. She wants to have a wider variety of products to sell and to offer attractive prices, in order to increase her income and improve her quality of life. In the future, she would like to buy a stand at the market so as not to have to sell door to door anymore, and to improve her house so that her children may grow up in a better environment.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene la edad de 41 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella con crédito lo quiere para la compra de pollos de engorde y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio le ayudará a él y a su familia a salir adelante. Es la primera vez que Vilma se financia con FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le ha brindaron muchas facilidades. Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Vilma is forty-one years old, married, and has four children. With this loan, she wants to buy chickens to fatten and then sell for profit. This will help her and her family improve their lot in life. This is the first time Vilma takes out a loan with the field partner. She says the credit committee helped her a lot and made the whole process very easy.
